Reviews.Title: “A good deal near LAX”
Reviews.Author: ansb10
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night before heading out, but enjoyed our stay. It seemed nicer and at a better price compared to others we had looked at. It's obviously an older hotel that's been renovated but they did a nice job in modernizing the lobby, outdoor space and rooms. The pool area and fire pit were nice touches. The room was a little on the smaller side but fine, with a (empty) fridge for your own water/drinks and bottled water was available to charge to your room. There were also wine glasses if you brought your own wine. The breakfast buffet wasn't huge, but was pretty good. The parking + breakfast are extra, but even with the additional cost it was less than other hotels in the area. There is some visible wear and tear, but for a short stay in LA on a budget we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View of the city on the 10th Floor.”
Reviews.Author: Rachel T
Reviews.Content: The staff at Custom Hotel are very friendly, specially this lady that help us on our check in and upgraded us to the 10th level room. sorry i forgot her name, and i lost the paper where i have her name, but the Hotel have this funky modern style to it, which i like, although some people might find it a bit dark, but me and my husband likes it a lot, it's very near the airport, although we hired a car, there's no free parking, only valet parking of $20 per night. although we park our car on the parking space for Ralph's Grocery store which is just next door to the Custom Hotel, we did that for 2nights that we stayed there, and our car seems fine, safe area, we have an early flight for New York so we stay in Custom Hotel and check out at 4am. the Reception is open 24hours. there's a Swimming Pool in the Hotel, and Restaurant although were mostly out so we were not able to try it out. The room is very clean and nice, The Bed is Japanese style a low type of bed frame, but it is very comfortable. we would stay here again, next time we go back L.A. and they also have a computer and printer you can use to print out your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, hip and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ribby34
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel in April. The rooms are well furnished with some interesting features like LED lighting in the windows and huge LCD TV's. Beds very comfortable and the pillows must have been feather or high quality synthetic ones as I slept soundly both nights. The outside area by the pool is well furnished with seating and a great place to chill although I did not take advantage of this. There is a small gallery on floor 8 which is worth a quick look, get key from reception. Located next door is a supermarket and across the road one of the best Italian restaurants I have eaten in. Close to LAX makes this a great tourist choice.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY, PROFESSIONAL, VALUE + LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I live in LA and have a number of visitors who stay at the Custom. This unique, modern and well staffed hotel has never resulted in an unkind word. My experience with staff and management is as good as any during my many travels. Van service and location in relation to LAX great. Neighborhood has much to offer - many resturants, grocery stores, recreation, in short walking distance plus beaches near and public transportation gets you to other Westside areas with ease. Try it, I think like me you will like the Custom. (Did I mention get pool area and unique end of day bar and restaurant specials at the hotel? Did now.)

Reviews.Title: “Good spot near LAX”
Reviews.Author: CoreenM
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my spacious room with views over the airport. Breakfast buffet was tasty. Daniel Hirsch was very accomodating and pleasant to deal with. Would recommend for a more interesting stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay...could use modifications”
Reviews.Author: stephbaker79
Reviews.Content: Customer Service was great....people are responsive and will do what they can to assist you...my heat was not working in my room and they sent an engineer within 3 mins. Food at the restuaraunt is delish...however the lounge is best if the weather permits...if its rainy or cold, you eat in the lobby which does not give off the same ambiance as the restuaraunt...the chef did his thing though cause my food was amazing...salmon and risotta...simply delish. My room and the hallway was dark but cute...The paint reminded me of basement floor paint but I appreciated the upscale Ikea look they where going for. The cardio room is super small and the treadmills are loud...they should spring for new equipment. They charge you for water in the room...tisk...tisk...and the parking...while I appreciated the valet parking, but I think parking in general should be free, but its LA so that may be too much to ask...parking was 20 bucks per night...The hotel is conveniently located next to shops, restuarants and a supermarket for easy access....quick ride to the airport too. This hotel is pet friendly...I dont think that the pets should be in the food area and they where...ILK...Lastly, my bed was a little hard, but I slept ok. Overall I would stay at the Custom again and recommend others with above disclosures.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX; but ....”
Reviews.Author: davemabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very retro. It needs to be modernized and get face-lifted. The room (420) showed its age as well as its need for maintenance. The bed was quite firm and very (modern) low. The bath really needs upgrading. Fit & finish by maintenance staff is needed. Lighting needed improvement as we could not deduce what one switch controlled. Heat lamp for shower did not work. We could not get the HD-TV to work. It appeared to exhibit network difficulties on all channels. I have seen the same effects at home when Time Warner Cable gets Hi-Def signals all screwey. In our room we also heard jet engines being started early in the morning. It does offer WiFi and hot breakfast. The breakfast quality left room to be drastically improved. But, it was quick. Valet overnight was a little pricy at $20.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not for kids”
Reviews.Author: vanbigslick
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel close to LAX. The check-in was easy and the staff friendly. Didn't use the shuttle but I know it's available. This is an older hotel that has been updated, but the rooms are still quite small and if you have a lot of bags it can be awkward. We had a 2 year old with us, and *everything* in the room was within reach, especially the low-slung TV and phone, along with the room wrap drapes. It wasn't ideal to have a kid in this room. The hotel seemed to be catering predominantly to the hipster crowd. Pros: Good HD TV content Recently reno'd Nice bar downstairs with good drink specials Very close to LAX (<5 minutes drive) Ralph's right next door if you need to grab provisions Cons: Decidedly not family friendly, everything in the room is within grabbing distance for kids Small room,Tiny bathroom $20 valet parking only (Tip: you can park on the nearby streets, Lincoln or Manchester, for free) Rack rate is expensive for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Can't put lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoad790
Reviews.Content: they tried to put lipstick on this pig of a hotel. Lobby is nice. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are simply awful. There is no other way to say it. Bed rests on a platform on the floor. No dresser. No desk. No coffee maker. No closet. Painted cement floors. Outdoor carpeting in room. Dark colors. Poor lighting. I was scheduled to stay for 3 nights and left after the first because I simply couldn't stand it. Very uncomfortable stay. Graffiti edged into elevator doors and walls also. Not a nice place. Unless you want a dorm room-like experience, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location....”
Reviews.Author: frankinbend
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. They have a very good shuttle service and just minutes away from LAX. Has always had great front desk staff and friendly drivers. A great Italian Resutrant, called Littly Italy's Kitchen is just across street. Works well for travelers having to overnight at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaikekoa
Reviews.Content: First do not order the $10.95 breakfast buffet at check in. Go to a nearby resteruant or pick up something at Ralph's grocery store next door. The breakfast is a typical free motel, eggs, one day sausage the next bacon, oatmeal and fresh fruits. Juice will cost an extra, I believe $4.95/glass. The rooms were clean with low platform Bed and flat screen TV. There is no dresser or refrigerator or microwave. Bathroom small with pedicel sink and tub/shower with rain shower head. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free airport shuttle. The lounge was nice. The area seems safe with many resteruants within walking distance. I would stay again just decline the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy S
Reviews.Content: The Custom Hotel's location is perfect for people wanting to be near LAX. It is near LMU, so it has a lot to do around it also. The staff was young and a bit green. The valet seemed a little out of it, and the shuttle service from the airport is not super reliable. I recommend calling far ahead of when you want them to pick you up, because even with the email I sent them to remind them the day before, I ended up taking a cab. I called, waiting 10 minutes and called back to make sure I was in the right place. They said the shuttle hadn't even left yet, so I got frustrated and grabbed a cab. If you are planning to do some work, definitely upgrade to the business level. There is no desk, so you end up having to spread out on the bed. Not ideal for business. Also, there are no drawers, so it would be a bit difficult for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: adventurebuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our road trip. It's very handy for the airport and if you've got a car then it's a good location to get to Santa Monica, Venice, Hollywood and downtown. The rooms are spacious and clean and there's not much noise from the road or airport. We also got a good last minute deal so it was good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, I'm in love.”
Reviews.Author: redshoegirl
Reviews.Content: After long work week, we just arrived here. I am staying only one night, my husband is staying 4. Randomly chose this based on price and proximity to LAX. New age-y hotel feel, and so cool. Valet parking only but they were super nice (24 hr valet). Greeted immediately, and were upgraded. Recommend upgrading even if you have to pay because I am right now sitting in a fabulous massage chair and quiet room offered to 12th floor guests. Ahh. Cool view of airport but surprisingly quiet. Will try and upload pics later. Can't wait to try dinner and happy hour here. Ralph's grocery next door for any necessities or booze to go. Airport shuttle every 1/2 hr (takes only 8 minutes). Think this might be a hidden gem for business and leisure travelers who want away from the craziness but be close to airport. Golf club is close, too. Now, back to my massage chair....

Reviews.Title: “good stop-over stay”
Reviews.Author: billandlinda_1951
Reviews.Content: Nicely refurished older building. Clean & professional.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty pathetic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaime M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Custom Hotel for 6 nights while I was visiting a college in Marina Del Rey. It is convenient in that it's located very close to LAX, but that's about as good as it gets. You're charged to use the business computers in the lobby, which to me seems a bit outrageous. There was no closet in my room, which was frustrating, and no cabinets, so very little storage space. My room also did not have a fridge or a microwave or a coffee maker. There was no where to put things in the bathroom, either. They charged for breakfast, even though it was just some crummy buffet. I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: pchoc6
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, clean hotel, with a retro 60s decor. The service was high quality, and I had a quiet, comfortable sleep. The outdoor restaurant/bar was interesting, something of an adventure. It doesn't look like much, but the food and wine was pretty good. There is a supermarket directly next door for convenience. This hotel is located in Westchester which is safer and quieter than the airport area. The limo they booked for me was fantastic. Most airport hotels are pretty unpleasant, but I liked it here. I would not go anywhere else when staying at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant convenient place to stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Custom one night prior to my departure to from LAX. It is a very pleasant hotel with the promised 3.5 star amenities. To be picked up at LAX you call the hotel and they send a driver to get you. I made the call and the driver was there in about 10 minutes. My room and the features of the hotel were as promised. The hype about â€œretroâ€� and â€œtrendyâ€� added a little color to the hotel but are nothing special. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it if you are looking for a pleasant convenient place to say in the LAX neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Greaaat”
Reviews.Author: wakeboarding-dave
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay near the airport Very hip and modern they should have free parking tough A plus in everything else

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Todd2PS
Reviews.Content: All of the other hotels at LAX, Los Angeles International are located in a no-mans land of parking lots and freight facilities, or some empty neighborhood. The Custom Hotel is next to a small, vibrant, lively neighborhood. OK, there are some things about this hotel that drove me crazy, like no in room coffee maker, but the location makes up for everything. There's a park across the street, two grocery stores, more than a half dozen restaurants, two bar/grills, a bank, coffee shop, yogurt shop, etc. Everything is walkable, and safe. The hotel is hip and trendy, so expect stark and modern. The pool area is small but charming. The breakfast is buffet is cheap and fast, although it starts a bit late for a business traveler. Fast Internet connections, good desk and chair, and refrigerator in the room. It's a Euro style bed, not good for anyone who has trouble getting out of a sports car... BUT, no in room coffee maker for the as you get ready cup of Coffee. It's all about the location especially if you're at LAX for a day or two. And, if you and not the company if paying you'll like all the local options.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and "cool"!”
Reviews.Author: 62RKE
Reviews.Content: Had a recent stay here before an early flight home out of LAX. I always dread this scenario because the LAX hotels are usually very expensive and some are not in a great or even safe area. Not dreading this anymore! The Custom is close to LAX but in a great neighborhood with shops and eateries very close by in walking distance. The staff were all helpful and friendly, which is really nice to see these days and makes a weary business traveler at ease! I checked out at 4:45 AM and even then the desk staff were happy and helpful as was the valet who had a smile and wished me a safe trip home. There is a parking fee which isn't cheap (I think it was $20 US/day) but this includes valet service so not that bad when you consider the reasonable room rate. The evening I arrived I stayed at the hotel and had happy hour food and drinks at Deck 33 (the on site eatery), which was a great find! It's a great spot; wifi works well there too and has comfortable places to sit with firepits and very friendly staff. Wifi also worked great throughout the hotel. The hotel room itself was quite small but clean and comfortable with a nice HDTV with a decent amout of channelsand Ipod docking station. If you want a big luxurious romm go elsewhere. If you want a clean comfortable and reasonably priced hotel that is also a fun place to stay - then stay here! Wifi also worked great throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcoming, friendly staff at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melanie O
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this great hotel twice in the past 3 months. Maile on reception is a delightful, helpful, multi tasking person who goes the extra mile to find info you might need. The free shuttle is very professional & efficient, run by a team of friendly young folk. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are very clean. I love that there is a Ralphs supermarket just around the corner - very well stocked. Very easy access to the blue bus and an easy journey north to Venice & Santa Monica. I have to say if you are in need of a substanial breakfast, this is the place to go. For $9.95, the choice is superb & well cooked - well done I loved it. We would recommend the Custom Hotel for a reasonably priced, clean & comfortable with a great team ready to help out at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Custom Hotel is located in nicer area around LAX”
Reviews.Author: Bikar777
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels around LAX that would offer you lower or comparable rates. However, this one is in very nice area where you can walk around feeling safe about it. There are nice restaurants, coffee shops and even a supermarket within walking distance. The hotel itself designed nicely as you normally see in Europe. Rooms look smaller than usual. Free Breakfast is not something you can count on. Its just some pastries and coffee. Parking is only Valet and is pricey when comparing to what you pay for the Hotel itself. Overall, its nice place and i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to lay your head before an early flight.”
Reviews.Author: Demo74
Reviews.Content: Hotel is hip, modern and trendy. Staff is friendly and accommodating. If you're a man size man, over 6 feet tall you may find the rooms and elevators a bit undersized. The hotel is 5 minutes from LAX and has a free punctual shuttle. Great place if you need a place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Rainburnsme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Custom two nights this last weekend while taking a class in nearby Santa Monica. From the Valet to the front desk to the maintenance guy I (literally) bumped into in the hallway the staff was very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the modern/retro decor of the hotel and the "outside the box" amenities offered. Such as the lounge on the 12th with massaging chairs. Very cool. I didn't hang out at the bar or resturant, instead I walked down the block and sampled some of the local flavor from the seemingly endless number of resturants on Lincoln and found some good stuff there! The room itself was comfortable. With a desk to study at while enjoying music from the in room iPod dock and watching the planes at LAX. My only grumble is a minor one. Parking is 20 bucks a night, plus tips, (unless you wanna be a jerk) tacked on to your bill if you valet your car. But, like I said, a minor beef if a beef at all. All things considered, I enjoyed my stay at Custom Hotel and would stay again! For the price in the area you can't beat fresh rooms, funky looks and the view from the 12th is great! Thanks Custom Hotel, I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Work in progress”
Reviews.Author: Ken21344
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience. Front desk advised that the shuttle picked up on a regular basis.... Not true, after waiting an hour we called and then waited another 1/2hour. The rooms are partially renovated in a 60's theme. The bed was mattress only almost on the floor. Very noisy from hallway noise. The hall walls were patched for paint .. Someday. Elevator badly graffitied. Included breakfast was incorrectly charged on credit card and computer not able to print on checkout. The statement was e-mailed incorrect and attempts to have it corrected to desk manager were ignored. Not a 3 1/2 star!! Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-stay night b4 cruise Custom Hotel LAX.”
Reviews.Author: trosk12
Reviews.Content: Located a mile and a half from LAX. Taxi fare $19.99 minum to location(high). Hotel staff very welcoming and friendly. Room IKEA style furnishings, bed ever so comfortable. Breakfast was $9.99. Good selection eat as much as you want. Receptionist arranged and negotiated price for taxi to Cruise Terminal in San Pedro($65.00). Overall Hotel Recommended especially after a eleven and a half hours flight from UK.

Reviews.Title: “Less funk, more spunk”
Reviews.Author: antnywallis
Reviews.Content: Revisiting the Custom Hotel almost a year later we can now see the effect of the changes wrought by the new management, JdV Hotels Group. [Check their site as they are really expanding in California:jdvhotels.com.] Much of the 'fun' has gone out of the place but it does work better, mainly due to the dedicated staff, esp.Tomas and Miley at the front desk. But any one of the young enthusiasts will solve problems for you at no cost. Kat is really helpful. So the fake sheep in the foyer disappeared long ago with the outsize photos in the lifts where one was entertained not by muzak but by the almost subliminal sound of various Euro languages. The rooms have been overhauled but not completely changed so that the linens are still excellent, so too the bed and the pillows. Frigs work now and the bathrooms are even more spic and span than before; they never were luxurious or large! The lighting is even worse now that the hotel has adopted some eco friendly moves such as 'green' light bulbs; bring a head-torch or book light. But the daylight is really beautiful from the great big tall windows (part of which may be opened for a breeze off the sea..). The original designer of the building was responsible for this & each room may depend upon a view of sky, facing West with water views high up, South to include the drama of LAX (the sound of which is blotted out by the double-glazing) East to a lovely park and only the North side low down is not so picturesque. All in all a big improvement now with new services available such as daily breakfast in the foyer at a reasonable price & a dedicated restaurant over the pool area for evenings. One unique feature of the CUSTOM: its proximity to LAX makes it possible to visit LA without hiring a car. The overseas visitor of the future may well be seen catching the municipal buses on Lincoln Boulevarde to visit nearby Venice & Santa Monica. Who really needs to investigate downtown LA when you have landed in this beautiful coastal strip of SoCal ?

Reviews.Title: “what a surprise”
Reviews.Author: kelvin f
Reviews.Content: the staff were very friendly and welcoming with lots of helpfull information. the room was well appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again BUT...”
Reviews.Author: j f
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot, both good and bad, about the Custom hotel prior to my trip. The rooms, hotel, the staff is totally OK but the hotel is missing a few of the most important accommodations to be able to pass for a good airport hotel. 1. Shuttle service forgot to pick us up. We booked shuttle 3 days prior to the trip (like the homepage said we could). We called, spoke to the front desk and sent en e-mail. When we arrived to LAX there was no shuttle there. Wohoo first time in US.. where to go? We had to call them again for them to pick us up. The explanation was that they had no booking from us. Come on! We are grown ups. Why even offer "the book before" service if it doesn't work? 2. No coffee until 7 am. I mean people are jet lagged, they need coffee whenever during the day/night. Airport hotel means guests form all over the world. A coffee machine in the lobby could save lives. Luckily there was a coffee shop and food store where one can get coffee 5.30 during weekdays. I've had few other guests expressing the same issue and asking me where they could get coffee. 3. The smoking area outside of the hotel is horrible. The hotel is a non smoking facility but guests arrive from all over the world. They do smoke. Give them some space where they could take their coffee and cigarette (outside the hotel of course). A place to sit and a table? Even other co-smokers thought it was a joke. But all and all if you're a non smoking, non coffee drinking person who doesn't mind being stood up by booked shuttle service after a 17 hrs flight be my guest.. or the guest of Custom hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great retro feeling hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: .The custom hotel has been updated with a retro feel. We enjoyed the restaurant and pool area. The location was excellent and we were able to access the public transportation system easily. The bath products we VERY nice. And the bed was comfy. We also loved the dean modern feel off the hotel. Each level has a themed. Common room. We were on the 11th floor and had access to all the common areas. These areas were a nice bonus. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I stay in hotel's over 100 nights out of the year, and this is the worst one I've ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: Pilot1982
Reviews.Content: From the poor and slow airport shuttle to the dank, haunted house like hallways, this place has a terrible feel. The rooms are small and dark with strange uncomfortable furniture, not what you want when your trying to feel at home. My tv didn't work and the staff had sarcastic attitudes. The very worst part was the perfume they used to cover up the stench. It smelled of a sex shop and burned my eyes. I had to sleep with the window open and listen to the traffic. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean airport hotel near Santa Monica Pier”
Reviews.Author: seputus
Reviews.Content: This is a great quality yet reasonably priced hotel near LAX airport. It's a quick 10 minute bus ride away from the airport, and is surrounded with a variety of eating establishments. Nice reception and charismatic concierge. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: will19
Reviews.Content: Compared with some tredy hotels it lacks the sophistication but the room was clean, people were nice. The food in their resturant was quite good and seemingly close to everything. Room was quiet although needed a little attention. Big Flat screen, free wireless. Great rate. Will definietly stay there again. The business center charged a bit much for copies etc. but what hotel doesn't these days.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, Great staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shanahan_18
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel stayed for four nights in September 2011 with my boyfriend (aged 22-23). Rooms are very clean and unique. The hotel is a lively hotel and has a very clean pool area. The pool area hosts a lot of pool parties, 3 during my stay. Which play loud music and a lot of people attend that are not staying in the hotel so you get to meet and talk to a lot of local people. The parties do start mid day and last almost all day with crowds of people staying all night in the hotel lounge and hotel bar drinking and dancing. The noise could be heard through out the night lasting until the early hours even though are room was on the top floor. The staff at the hotel were so helpful and kind giving advice about car rental and day trips, the staff couldn't do enough for you they printed maps and directions for us. The location of the hotel is about a 20 minute journey on the bus, and the bus is very cheap. Over all stay was great and I would stay here again, however I do think the hotel is more suited to younger people as it is lively and noise levels can be high. The hotel also offers a free ride from LAX airport which is great just give them a ring when you get to the airport, The driver gives you free bottled water and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “"a new experience in travel"”
Reviews.Author: darrell s
Reviews.Content: I visited LA this past weekend to attend my son's football game.I selected this hotel based on the reviews and the fact that they were a pet friendly hotel.I was extremely impressed by the simplicity,but yet contemporary style of this hotel.The staff was pleasant by all means,they upgraded me when the heat was not working in the room I was asslgned.The doggy park was a treat as well.The comfort of the beds stood out,I slept very sound.I also have to mention the lime water in the lobby....superb!Forgot to mention Tomas who checked me in was courteous,polite and professional.The price I paid for my stay was a steal.......Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles Airport Hotel with hip character and humour”
Reviews.Author: craig-eki
Reviews.Content: I visit LA regularly and often it makes sense to stay close to the airport. I love the Custom Hotel - contemporary, simple, friendly staff, great sense of style. Free wifi, close to supermarket, restaurants not too far away. A firm favourite.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcomed Surprise After A Long Flight”
Reviews.Author: Carole W
Reviews.Content: I was in-between fights between Christmas and New Years and walk into the lobby of the Custom Hotel to ask to see a room before booking A reservation, I spend several days every month in Hotels and am looking for more than just a place to sleep at night, I am also chemically sensitive/allergic to many of the harsh cleaning supplies and air freshener often used in hotels. I was greeted by the most pleasant receptions group with smiles and attitudes of how can we help you. Thomas was not only friendly and outstanding but also kind, to understand my questions and then show me the room which was suitable for an allergic individual my welcomed surprise. Thomas and the others then made my stay secure, restful and happy. When I checked out I am sorry I forgot the bellmanâ€™s names he was originally from Ethiopia I believe, was so cheerful and helpful such a nice way to start my day. I felt so nourished and well taken care of during my entire stay by everyone. Thank You all at Custom Hotel. I appreciated your assistance. It was the best hotel I stayed in in 2011. I look forward to my next trip to LA in January and the Custom Hotel. Carole Wolfsen

Reviews.Title: “Route 66 end”
Reviews.Author: Johnpaul3006
Reviews.Content: Great hotel stayed here at end of our flydrive from uk, doing route 66 brilliant end to great holiday organised by Jetsave.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelismypassion504
Reviews.Content: Good shuttle service from the airport to the hotel, they were very quick and detailed as to where the shuttle will pick us up from LAX. Custom Hotel is a great location, you could see the airport from the room but you donâ€™t hear the planes in the hotel. Very trendy and more eco-conscious, as the hotel provides soap/shampoo etc. with natural ingredients (not the cheap chemical ones that most hotels provide). The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool and the bar by the pool looked really trendy as well. I would definitely stay there again and try out the other Joie de Vivre hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fun”
Reviews.Author: lalalatracy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Custom Hotel for 1 night before my evening flight the next day. Location is very close by airport & car hire places, big super market next door, shops & a few restaurants within walking distant, Marina del Rey is close by also. Valet parking is $24 per night, there are other parkings around but we are never too sure if you are allowed to park overnight...so valet parking is safer option plus the valet service is pretty good. They also have free shuttle service to airport which is fab, the drivers are really friendly. Check was fine, easy enough, we requested for late check out which we were told it was extra 50$ & it will be til 5pm, but when we decided to take up the offer the next day, it went up by 10$ & 1 hr less, so if you want to late check out double check the prices & time, its like the stock market. Rooms are ok size with fun colourful LED lights by the window, shampoo, conditioner, body wash are available & in nice packaging, however that is where the amenities end. WIFI was available pretty much everywhere in the hotel & its part of the package. Beds are double, bit small, there are no wardrobes- just a rail to hang things, there is no mini fridge either. The clock in my room was wrong- was 1 hr back, luckily i didn't rely on it to catch a plane! Due to incorrect clock & check in time being 1 hr less, I lost 2hrs of precious packing time, which meant I packed everything in the large lobby downstairs, spread my stuff out all over the tables! Hotel was dog friendly & dogs get given treats, its so cute & such a nice touch. hotel has pool & restaurant but I didn't try out any food as cheesecake factory was not too far away! All in all, nice stay for 1 night, wouldn't stay any longer but would def return & recommend

Reviews.Title: “Cool and affordable hotel when in LA”
Reviews.Author: NYCtreks
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers cool, modern rooms, at great prices. Friendly front desk gets you in fast, pool is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will I stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Willywill1
Reviews.Content: This place to sum it up sucks!!!! Scammers do not give them ur credit card!!!!! Night time manager maguel should be fired and put in jail!!! Rooms are small and plain.... Bed are horrible... And the bathrooms dont even get me started!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dorm Room Comfort”
Reviews.Author: AKNoes
Reviews.Content: The rooms resemble dorm rooms with sparse furnishings. It looked clean - but this is one of those hotels that decorates throughout with dark paint and decor and has poor lighting. The walls are thin and we could hear conversations outside our room. Don't pay extra for "elevated rooms". There is nothing special about the view from these rooms. Also, only two of three elevators (small) seemed to be operating and were very slow - in the morning, after waiting twice for an elevator with room for us we took the stairs. If you have a lot of bags and are leaving in a hurry in the morning, plan ahead for extra time to wait for an empty elevator. We chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and seemed to be one of the few airport hotels that did not have a bed bug report in the bed bug registry. We checked out bug bite free. If you arrive late and plan to get a shuttle, expect to wait for at least half an hour. Your companion may wonder like mine did, why we didn't book the Raddisson, Hyatt or any of the other major hotels since we saw at least four cycles of shuttles from these hotels come and go as we continued to wait for the Custom shuttle. Apparently it takes them longer to get to the airport in the evening, despite being just a couple of miles away. Perhaps they were feeding me a line, in any case be warned. This hotel is funky and located in a funky area. The nearby restaurants were mediocre. Breakfast buffet didn't look great. We passed on it and went to a nearby coffee shop. Don't stay her unless you like dorm rooms and get a rock bottom rate. You can probably get a room for $70 or less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff and Very good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rich B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay if flying to or from LAX. I will difinately return and stay there.The staff and service can't be beat.Great food at the restuarant.Walking distance to other eateries and shopping.Great value for the price.*Pets are welcomed.*The personal attention the guest recieve cant be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: joakimraboff
Reviews.Content: Custom Hotel is the prefect hotel when you have a night or two stop-over in L.A. and can't be bothered to leave the airport area. As great a city as Los Angeles is, with a ton of stuff to see and do, the bottom line is that you need time to enjoy your stay here. So, if your stay is short, you're better off keeping close to the airport and just lounging in the hotel's pool area, in the restaurant or sipping a latte in one of the nearby cafÃ©s. There's also a bowling alley and a Ralph's supermarket next door. Custom Hotel offers guests a free shuttle to and from the airport (LAX) â€“ more or less at your convenience. WiFi is also included in the room rate. Breakfast is not but can be bought in the lobby where a buffet is set up each morning. You can also purchase a toasted bagel and other breakfast items in the lobby cafÃ©. Finally, Custom Hotel's staff are genuinely friendly, rooms are comfy and clean and even if the restaurant's offerings are a tad on the pricey side, the meals we ate were tasty and generously portioned.

Reviews.Title: “diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: sbolson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a handful of times and each time I like it more. I was in a suite with my kids this trip which was very large and with three kids you need alot of room. As always the customer service was excellent. For the price you would think you were staying at a 5 star hotel..

Reviews.Title: “A unique airport hotel that celebrates the airport.”
Reviews.Author: TGP67
Reviews.Content: I just completed my first stay at the Custom. My flight from the East Coast was due to arrive late in the evening, and at the last minute I decided I didn't want to drive home. Hotel Tonight featured this hotel for a great rate, and I had wanted to visit it. And so the deal was struck. I read the various reviews, and both good and bad are largely spot on. Your perception of the Custom will depend on your needs and expectations. Do not stay here if you want cookie-cutter sameness or generic wall art or a bed you have to climb up into. This is an older hotel that has been recently remodeled with a hip new style. The age of the hotel still shows through at times, including the musty smell, and the hip decor won't appeal to everyone - like the stark walls and low bed. All that said, I enjoyed my stay very much. All of the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to make me feel welcome, from the complimentary airport pickup, to the very helpful Gerald at reception and Tomas at checkout. The public areas are great - an open lobby was a cool gathering place and the site of a very good buffet breakfast for under $10. I wasn't able to enjoy the bar, restaurant or pool, but they looked to be nice spots to enjoy with friends. There was a mixed crowd of guests, with many apparently visiting from Europe. The room was simple, but clean and with many amenities. Wifi was available throughout the hotel, and its being complimentary put this place a notch above standard airport hotels that charge in excess of $10/day. The bath products were by Lather, and the bed linens were very comfortable. There was a dock for iPods and unique LED lighting that functioned nicely for mod moodlighting as well as a night light. The desk mat explained how to use all the room features, and provided interesting information about its past (it was designed by Weldon Becket, same guy who designed Hollywood's iconic Capitol Records tower, and I might add a host of other recognizable buildings, including the Cinerama Dome at the Arclight and Disney's Contemporary Resort A-frame) What I'll remember about my stay at the Custom versus my many stays at more nondescript airport hotels is that this place actually celebrates its next door neighbor, LAX. The LED lights evoke the color-changing pillars at the airport entrance, and the double-paned windows allowed me to enjoy watching the flights arrive and depart, without the annoyance of their noise. I slept very well. Almost every floor has a common area in the center core, from the "Duty Free" vending area to the game room to the art gallery. My favorites were on the "elevated" level - one resembles an airport lounge, complete with screens showing arrival/departure info and a computer you can use for printing boarding passes. The surprise treat was discovering the Stratosphere lounge on floor 12 - this peaceful cloud-themed lounge boast two massage chairs. My 20 minutes relaxing in one was absolutely incredible. It's hard to strike a balance between value and luxury, but if the Custom continues to deliver comfortable accommodations with a wide set of amenities at a decent price, I'll be back. And not just when I'm at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ron3573
Reviews.Content: The Custom Hotel is a great place near the airport, but not in the airport area which has nothing going on. A least here you have stores, a park and other places to walk to. The hotel has great customer service and it's clean. It also has a complimentary shuttle to the airport. If you need to be near the airport and want something different try the Custom.

Reviews.Title: “You will either love it or hate it”
Reviews.Author: TortMad
Reviews.Content: I stopped at The custom hotel on a road trip from Las Vegas to San Fransisco, I stopped here for two nights and it was easily my most favourite of all the hotels that I stopped at on the way. (I do love Boutique hotels however). The Custom hotel has been recently re-designed and refurbished with a minimalistic and modern style. The rooms are of a decent size and are fresh and clean. The walls are covered in fabric and have a Plasma TV on the wall. There is also an IPod docking station, tea and coffee making facilities, in room safe, bath and shower. The beds are comfortable and in my opinion no lower than any other bed in any other hotel. The hotel also has a pool, bar and restaurant. The pool area is a modern and mellow space with covered cabanas, double sun lounges and patio heaters. On Saturday afternoons/evenings a pool party takes place here where it can become roudy and rather busy. It also means that the pool is out of action at this time. Next door to the hotel there is a Ralph's supermarket, which sells, sandwiches, breakfast items and all sorts of essentials you may need, a pet shop and a Diner. The hotel is surrounded by local restaurants inc Italian and Chinese and world famous fast food outlets. Right across from the hotel lobby is a bus stop for those who don't have a car. It is just a 20 minute trip to Santa Monica which also is the main transport hub to the greater Los Angeles area. On that note the hotel also provide a free shuttle to the nearby LAX airport. The area surrounding the hotel is quiet and I never felt uncomfortable walking around the area at night and as a group of three females this was very important to us. The hotel also offers free wifi, however I was never able to access it, the front desk offered their assistance and when nothing helped they offered to contact the I.T department for me. The Custom hotel is also Pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Time!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff W
Reviews.Content: The VP of Sales for my company organized a party for the Managers + 1 celebrating our 2011 success. We had the party in the Mile High Room and we booked rooms to stay the evening. The Mile High Room was perfect for the size of our group and the service was terrific. My room was great, a nice retro feel to it. Very comfortable bed and given the proximity to LAX very quiet. Checked out the bar by the pool; great drinks and service there as well. An excellent time and I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Turn Away”
Reviews.Author: kam c
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I was NOT greeted and NOT informed of holding charges to my credit card. It was simply taken to which I assumed was for verification reasons. Upon getting to my room and checking my account did I notice the charge and had to call and inquire from the front desk. The rooms were small and empty. They completely lacked what my expectations of a 3 1/2 start hotel are. I had to call to the front desk to get a change of towels. Overall for the price tag that is placed on the hotel and expensive cost of valet I was highly disappointed in my entire experience. So much so that when asked by a local friend of mine as to where we were staying I declined to answer for fear of embarrassment. This hotel should accurately advertise itself to the public in being overpriced and under furnished, and lacking in overall promise. If the hotel would spend more money on making the rooms live up to the standards of that of the lobby then it would be up to par. The rooms attempt to be high class get a C- at best. The lobby on the other hand gets an A. When I walked in I was impressed but quickly let down by the staff and room quality. I have never walked in to a room and felt the need to inspect the bedding for bedbugs. There were none found but the fact that I felt the need to speaks volumes in my comfort level. The room was below standards in the fact that the bottoms of the walls looked like toddlers had kicked them numerous times. There was virtually zero furniture. The elevators had what looked like etchings from taggers all over them. The attempt to make the rooms look sheik and hip came across as cheap and unable to afford the desired look.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: cameragurl
Reviews.Content: The room was great was, it was clean roomy and cool. We got a room away from the elevator and i think one of the corner room. The bathroom was little bit small but clean.The room was cozy and quite a little unusual but I love the style.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique option at LAX”
Reviews.Author: gotech1
Reviews.Content: Let me start this by saying I love boutique hotels. Custom Hotel is a cool, quirky option at LAX. The price was fantastic, about $115 for a king room and for another $30 or so I received a late check-out of 8:00 p.m.; perfect for red-eye flights back to the East Coast. Staff members were young but extremely friendly and accommodating. They extended my already late check-out an extra hour. The lounge was equally as friendly, no attitude in this hotel. The lobby, lounge and rooms were great. The corridors could use an upgrade though, they don't do justice to the rest of the building. Room was quiet and cozy, the bed is in the center of the room, unusual but unique. It would be nice to have a stocked mini-bar but there is a grocery store next door. I look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: adventerouscanadian
Reviews.Content: We didnt know what to expect after booking this property based on some of the reviews but were glad we did. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. from the moment we arrived. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. A shuttle is provided to the airport which is less than 10 minutes away and street parking can be found if you are willing to walk a couple of blocks.There is no resort fee and internet usage is complimentary. there are restaurants very close by and the hotel has an adjoining restaurant with good food and a good selection of wine. I wouldnt hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump”
Reviews.Author: PPAShenzhen_China
Reviews.Content: This is what happens when I avoid the 'name' brands . Dirty everywhere. I knew I had made a mistake when I got into the old, beat-up, elevator. Rooms are seriously inconvenient. No desk, very poor lighting, beds are only a few inches off the floor. Old building recently renovated as cheaply as possible and shows it. Strangely enough, the associated restaurant has really good food.

Reviews.Title: “Way Improved- New Owner, New Chef”
Reviews.Author: Laura J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the custom Hotel for 5 nights and ate in their adjoining Deck 33 for 3 meals. The room was decent size, they are super pet friendly, staff was all great! The night we flew in they had a wind storm and lost power for 3 or 4 hours, and they couldn't do much but all the drinks were on the house (their orange juice is squeezed in house!) The lobby coffee is NOT good, but only because they do not have a dedicated barista. There is a coffee shop around the corner. The food however is EXCELLENT, and would cost 2-3 times what they are charging if you ordered it in DC. I had an omlette that was fantastic, the Short Rib dinner is amazing, and the they have a saturday/sunday "hangover brunch" that is great! Nothing like 10 dollar bottomless mimosas! When we checked in they gave us a bag of treats and toys for the dog, as well as doggy doo bags! The parking came out to 12/day, which honestly is cheap in LA. They had a nice lounge/bar, nice outdoor areas with covered posh cabanas around their inground pool. There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance, italian, gastropub, sushi, a cool diner... Next door is a nice grocery, a pet supply, and a bowling alley. On the other side are shops. There is even a liquor store across the street. Room was quiet considering the bustle that is LA. We were on the 3rd floor, but slept very well! They have a room on the 3rd floor with a big TV and gaming systems, on the 5th and 6th floor are work out rooms, on the 11th floor is a nice business area with tvs showing the airport information on flights, and on the 12th floor is a nice private room with massage chairs! If you are in town for shopping and end up leaving with more than you brought, there is even a scale in the lobby. Only reasons this did not get a 5 out of 5 from us is that we like to have a small fridgerator in the room to keep things cold, and could not upgrade to a suite because we had our dog with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tara H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Custom Hotel for a long weekend away with a friend. The rooms were basic but well decorated and the beds comfortable. The staff was very friendly and there were nice touches like cucumber infused water in the lobby. We went to the attached restaurant for their happy hour and enjoyed our $5 appitizers and nice wine. I would have liked to have a fridge in the room. There were upgraded rooms with fridges but we didn't want to pay extra for something that is standard in a lot of hotel rooms. The location too is great, easy to get to where we wanted to go and quick to get back to the airport at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: amelia w
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called to make our reservation, to the time of check-out, the staff at Custom was truly amazing. Tomas helped me with my reservation and when I called to book it he was on another call. He quickly returned my call and I requested a "city view" being that it was my first visit to LA, he said he would do his best to accommodate me. Custom has a free airport shuttle service, I called when I got off the plane and they were there within ten minutes to pick me up, in a nice car : ) Upon checking in, Tomas was there to greet me and my room request was waiting for me....top floor, city view. Being a New Yorker, I naturally inquired about public transportation, I was given specific directions (with a bus map) to get to Santa Monica, which was less than a twenty minute bus ride away. The following day there was a pool party with a DJ and beer and wine. That night there was a Brazilian band playing in the club connected to the hotel, it was great music and lots of dancing! We didn't get a chance to check out the restaurant because it closed early the night we tried to go, but the menu looked great. I did have a tasty coffee and scone in the lobby cafe. The last night we were there we waited too late to eat dinner and not much was open, but the staff had the perfect recommendation and it was right across the street. We also used their awesome free airport shuttle service to go rent a car at the airport. He took us directly to the Avis rental car center! While we were there, they were working on some renovations in the lobby, that was a draw back, but it didn't get in the way too much. The only other draw back was I wish the restaurant/bar would have stayed open a little later... Can't wait to return....loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, trendy and great location for LAX, Marina del Rey, Loyola Marymount”
Reviews.Author: DocTrvlr
Reviews.Content: JDV properties really upgraded the place with well designed new rooms, although the bathrooms could use an a retrofitting. There is a beautiful lounge and really nice gym. each floor has a different theme lounge on it to explore. Free Wi-Fi and great pool with nice dining there although no room service which is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the hotel twice before - once when it was the Furama, and then again earlier this year when JdV hotels had taken over. The hotel is a great choice at LAX. It is comfortable and convenient. You pay for valet parking ($19 per night) but at a lower rate than the mainstream hotels. There is a coffee shop on the corner and a grocery store next door. I had a corner room facing the ocean. Great views and sunsets. And at Â£50 per night including taxes - a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “GLORIFIED DORM ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: rob c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a Friday prior to flying out of LAX for our vacation. We did the stay and park package where you leave your car their for a week while you're gone. The price for the stay and park package was good ($228) and cheaper than just parking our car at LAX. The service was weak though (aside from the vallets who were great and professional). We booked our room the previous night through their reservation service. When we arrived they couldn't locate our reservation so they booked us again (we were double charged when I reviewed our credit card statement). The rooms are small and the hotel is old. It attempts to make it a chic hotel but it feels like a dorm room. The bar was nice, no complaints there. When we walked into the lobby it reaked of weed, though that could have been the guy next to us checking out. If you're looking for a place to park while leaving LA or if you're young and don't care much about the accomodations and are just looking to party, then this hotel would fit the bill. As for us, we weren't impressed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights on honeymoon,absolutely fantastic stay,room was clean and comfortable,well stocked with toiletries & coffee making facilities,front desk & concierges all excellent-very friendly and helpful! Great location for LAX,not so great for Hollywood unless you drive,about $70 for a taxi...nice area though with plenty of places to eat/drink and Ralph's supermarket next door for the essentials! Ralph's was open until 2am,and even at this time the area was safe and well lit...cannot fault this place on anything,would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in LAX”
Reviews.Author: Cartabosh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to be close to the airport before my flight. I could have booked other hotels in the area but I chose custom because it looked like a funky hotel (felt like I was in New York hotel). The room was very nice and spacious I really liked the mood lighting and the design. The bathroom amenities were really nice considering your staying at the airport for the type of location you wouldn't expect this. 10 points for the Ipod dock!!!! If I had to stay close the the airport again I would choose to stay here again. I didn't get to use the gym but its was ok I took a photo of the gym. The only complaint I would have is the really crappy old shower head!!! at least get a water saving shower head, that was the only thing the ruined the room otherwise everything else was perfect. There is even a Ralphs supermarket next door so its in a really good area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: oneillsurfacad
Reviews.Content: from the airport pickup through to the restaurant, you can have a great stay at a great price. booked through expedia at a great rate the rooms are clean, spacious. The beds are comfy and I cannot think of a better place to stop off close to LAX. Have stayed here before, 3 years ago and the place just gets better and better on each visit. Wonderful and helpful staff made our short stay here just perfect. Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Hip hotel with great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Star_Child79
Reviews.Content: I was recently in LA for business and found a great Expedia rate for this hotel. Being in the hotel industry I have always worked for boutique and independent resorts thus my desire to stay at a Joie de Vivre property. My first interaction was with the complimentary airport pickup driver Chris. I found him to be very friendly and knowledgeable. He was top notch. The hotel was very euro-sheik-hip and quite clean. I loved the multi colored LED lights and the shower was great! I have to say they did a great job on tailoring the rooms to the corporate traveler, loved the wide pedestal sinks! They provided lots of space to put your stuff. I utilized the cardio and weight room each morning and found them adequate, nothing spectacular but they certainly got the job done, also very clean. The pool area looked very inviting but it was a little too chilly to go in, next time! Deck 33 (restaurant) had a diverse menu, tasty food and prompt friendly service with a smile. Michael was a terrific server. Xandra assisted me at check out; she was superb in every way. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone and I will certainly be back. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away!”
Reviews.Author: jennsfc
Reviews.Content: I love the Custom Hotel. It is my home away from home. When I need a weekend away (kids, in-laws, husband, work, life), I book an overnight at the custom hotel. I love the east check-in/parking and location. This hotel is not just for the travelling. I stay there maybe 4 times a year for a weekend away to sleep, eat and regenerate. The 5th floor is funky and by the last night of my stay I sometimes ask my husband to join me for Sunday's by the pool. The beds are my favorite. Super comfy and sleeping in is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Super cool airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_Arica
Reviews.Content: What a lucky break. We were hoping to score a bearable hotel close to LAX. This came on a recommendation from a young boutique hotel owner in Santa Barbara. It pays to ask the locals. I'd read some reviews about it after the suggestion and decided to return our rental car prior to our stay because apparently it can be inconvenient to access your car once parked. Excellent decision. They picked us up right from Budget in a sexy black Suburban. The hotel is an oldie that's been refurbished. Mod, hip, but real. We were nervous about being trapped w/o transportation close to the airport, but that was no issue at all. The place is fully equipped with a bar & restaurant that overlooks the pool and fire pit and exotic cabanas. Amazingly cool. Super sweet staff all around. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Stay-cation Cool!”
Reviews.Author: 1KraftyQuilter
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The rooms are nice. The restaurant Deck 33 overlooks the pool. Happy hour was yummy, breakfast too. The pool area is very relaxing. It felt like we were on a topical island, but really only an hour from home. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised ...”
Reviews.Author: athlux
Reviews.Content: According to the website this hotel established itself a lifestyle boutique hotel. If you enter the lobby the first impression seems that it is worth the price. If you exit the elevator the good impression slowly fades away. Very dark hallways lead to your room. Upon entering the room you will notice curtains covering the walls and the low beds. (which are strange enough ok to sleep in) The mood lights turn out to be small LEDs on the windows with a remote. Barely visible and from the looks of it, the wiring seems not to be safe. All in all a ok location for a layover I you can get a decent price. If you want to spend a longer time in LA I would suggest to check-in into another place. We parked at the park across the street because valet parking was not even in a secure location but instead on the open parking lot behind the hotel Would not stay there again. The only good thing was the location right near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “hip and affordable”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, and it is born of a request by the Custom Hotel to write it. That alone wouldn't have sufficed, but for the staff's obvious investment and pride in the hotel. Like good restaurants, after the initial verve, staying power is tied to sincere pride in one's business, and each person with whom I was in contact was proud of this place. First, it has been professionally and creatively "refreshed" (as they say) style-wise, and I enjoyed the retro '60's touches. I enjoyed my stay in part because everything felt thought-through and style-conscious. Where I am not style-conscious, I can appreciate its value. Second, it was a place one would seek to eat and to relax independent of whether one were staying there. The restaurant was well-styled and the food great. The selection was relatively small, but notwithstanding, only an overly-finicky person wouldn't have found something interesting to eat. The pool-side deck and evening bar were hip and able to accommodate the array of potential guests. I appreciate the sincerity of the wait staff (I elected to eat all my meals at the hotel, in large part due to a positive breakfast experience on the first day). Last, I enjoyed the new and creative way by which they oriented me to the hotel's amenities (e.g., an ink-blotter on the desk/end table conceived as an airline emergency procedures trifold). The staff was very accommodating, and with their efforts was able to conduct some business, but I think a more robust and accessible business room or similar room (e.g., with printing, scanning, faxing) would be helpful to attract more business folks. Likewise, the electrical system is not prepared for the 21st century's need for several plugs to charge/use several devices. My last (minor) critique is that the interactive TV isn't terribly interactive, and I gave up after a while, as it became too difficult to simply watch a baseball game. On the whole, were I on business travel in and out of L.A., this place would come instantly to mind, and I'd enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “"The Purr-fect Property for Passing Thru LAX!"”
Reviews.Author: AmericaOverEasy
Reviews.Content: I live a good bit of my life at 35,000 feet or in hotel rooms, and when I step off the plane in LA, the last thing I look forward to is having to sit in LA Freeway traffic to find a comfy bed for the night. The Custom is just purr-fect for nesting nearby LAX, has a bowling alley within a baseball toss, a great pub across the road, 24 hour grocery shopping and that's just to mention a few of the local seductions; like good Italian food, walks in the park, or great Thai you'll be pleased to meander away from the hotel's very trendy pool club and meeting place settings. The furnishing are all trendy, and my bed was lower to the ground than I'm accustomed but I had a great night's sleep and the Staff is "ta die for!" The cherry on the top of the hotel's attraction is the fact that they'll 'send a sleek black car to collect me from the airport' and its a whopping 12-14 minutes from the curbside of LAX before I'm in the lobby, asking for a room with a view. Mark Sheehan, author of "America Over Easy!" The KNOW BEFORE You Go Guides.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising gem near LAX”
Reviews.Author: RamblingShirley
Reviews.Content: Who would ever stay near LAX? I was not looking forward to being in this location near one of the country's busiest airports, but I had a pleasant surprise when I was booked into the hotel for a meeting at nearby Loyola Marymount University. The hotel provides a free shuttle right from LAX and delivers the weary traveller into a hip, fun lobby. The room, which was on the small side, was perfectly designed to accomodate a traveller's needs--comfortable bed, extra chair, flat-screen tv,free wifi, hairdryer, iron, but best of all, perfect iPod dock alarm clock. I loved the quirky light feature in the window. Guests have a remote control to choose the color of their lights, and whether they stay on or flash or turn off completely. There is a lovely lobby set up as a "departure" lounge where breakfast is available in the morning at an extra charge. The communal tables have pop-up electrical outlets for surfing the Web and checking email. There is a lovely pool area with a bar and restaurant perched above the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 441Bruce
Reviews.Content: Every one from the shuttle driver , Front desk and F and B staff rocked. The staff went over and above to make sure I felt at home and my stay was pleasant. Maile at the front desk was informative and funny.

Reviews.Title: “Hippest @ LAX”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting for The Custom. Until it came around there was a major lack of hip hotels at LAX, and why should travelers be forced to stay at standard-issue hotels at the airport? Why not stay in style at a converted building {designed by same architect as the Capitol Records building} channeling the Jet Age? I checked in early, as well as requested a slightly later check-out, and the staff gladly accommodated my request with a smile. What's more, when you're waiting for the shuttle, to check-in or to check-out, the lobby has been thoughtfully designed with ample seating and lots of standing-with-suitcases room. The hotel is in a perfect location: 3 mins from LAX, 10 mins from Venice and 15 mins from Santa Monica. All in all, it's a convenient, a reasonably-priced and a mod addition to LAX's hotel offering. I would absolutely stay again, and if I only had a short stay in LA, The Custom is the perfect take-off point for exploration, beach time or relaxation by the pool. What I liked - size of safe, big enough for a lap top - staff extremely friendly - cardio & weights gyms - shuttle to/from LAX runs every half hour - lemon water in lobby - cafe in lobby - bar33 restaurant - design of the entire hotel, especially the pool area {they took a basic pool and made it fabulous with graduated tanning areas, comfy couches, cool plants, shaded cabanas, gas fire pits = bravo} - the hotel is also right beside a Ralph's grocery store and 30 steps from a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf cafe which ups its convenience factor What to know - rooms are large and decor is minimalist - it's a older, converted building, so soundproofing isn't the best---sleep with earplugs

Reviews.Title: “overbookings...”
Reviews.Author: praguelover_9
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay at this hotel for two nights as we were very much attracted to the nice design and the positive vibe about this hotel. But when we called the hotel when we arrived at the airport to get a shuttle, they didn't tell us we would be confronted with an overbooking. They could have told us so whe didn't have to go first to Custom Hotel, but directly to the other hotel. We gave the shuttle driver a tip, but didn't have to do that because five minutes later we had to grab a taxi to another hotel. They had a solution for us, but we were just lucky. We got a taxi before some other guests could get one to the other hotel, so when we arrived at Embassy Suites, we heard we were the last people that could sleep at Embassy Suites. So the other ones were unlucky. The manager told us he already had said to Custom Hotel they were fully booked, but they kept on sending people to their hotel. I find it very strange, because we already booked months in advance, so there was no way the hotel was fully booked when we were booking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Niall O
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently in the Custom Hotel in LA and the level of customer service I received was excellent. The staff (Susie and Tomas) were friendly and accommodating in every way. On arrival there was a power shortage and the staff went out of their way to ensure that all of our needs were met, the rooms were discounted, drinks were complimentary and they even discounted car parking. The rooms are comfortable with all mod cons and the poolside area, bar and cafe are very nice. The hotel itself is located 5 minutes away from Marina Del Rey and Santa Monica and close to LAX. During my time in LA I had stayed at another more expensive hotel in West Hollywood which could not match the quality, location or customer service. This will definitely be my first choice on my next trip to LA and I have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not a premier boutique...yet”
Reviews.Author: tbone6
Reviews.Content: Bathrooms seemed a little dated, but not awful, Refrigerator oddly missing leaving a big void in the cabinet where it used to be, and the room climate control was either freezing/sweltering-hard to find happy medium. I went to the pool Sunday morning but there were no towels, cups floating in the pool and assorted paper/debris at the bottom. Decided against the morning swim. However-some cool upgrades from the previous version; improved: valet (but you pay for it), lobby area, room nuances/media. I like the location and price for when I need to be in the LAX/Venice/Manhattan Beach areas.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are a reasonable size, but do not have any drawer space, just two boxes near the door. There is no hairdryer, no coffee machine and no chairs, just two stools. These are placed at the foot of the beds, just in the right position to trip you over in the night! There is no information in the room about the hotel and its facilities. However, despite lacking all these things, there is a strange lighting system on the windowsill. This is operated by a remote control and can be programmed to flash and change colour. Just the thing you don't need! The bed linen was creased and looked used. The bed base sticks out and it is easy to bang your leg on it. I realise that this is classed as an airport hotel, but still feel that it needs a few changes in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “As a designer, I feel drawn back to the decor...”
Reviews.Author: idealdan_TA
Reviews.Content: The initial impression of this place was pretty typical from the outside - your average hotel near the airport. When we walked in though, I was immediately intrigued by the unique and stylish decor. The lobby had a mid-century-meets-1980's art-deco vibe and the elevators up to our room had enormous, floor-to-ceiling photos of closeups of people's faces. Very cool, and out of the ordinary. The hallways (walls, floor, ceiling) were painted this muted grey color, and it had this David Lynch feel to it while walking to our room. Once inside, we were greeted with full wall length white curtains and minimalist retro decor. I guess our room had a dog theme, since the pillows, throw, and carpet had these tiny embroidered M.C. Coolidge-esque designs on them. Strange, but refreshing from the usual boring wallpaper and drab linens of most hotels. Overall it was clean, quiet and the hot water/water pressure was great. Perfect for sleeping, and leaving the next day. The pool looked cool, and the lounge next door was something I would have checked out if we didn't have a tight itinerary already. I'd stay here again to explore the floor that I hear is made up of vending machines...yeah, I don't know either.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff and food! my new fav hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brittani W
Reviews.Content: I am currently still checked into Custom hotel. I have been here for about 4 days so far and i love it! Jasmine checked me in and has done everything she could to make my stay wonderful! she is AMAZING! the blonde girl at the bar is so friendly and made me feel so welcome. I promise this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in and will be sure to come back.Valet is fast and super polite too! i have never been ANYWHERE with so many nice staff people! Thank you Custom Hotel! You have made my trip to Los Angeles a great one!

Reviews.Title: “scary”
Reviews.Author: kp20081
Reviews.Content: very dark, not very clean, small rooms but trendy! well located only if you are thinking on going lax

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service, but be prepared to pay extra for EVERYTHING.”
Reviews.Author: themysteryunfolds
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice now. The first time was with a friend in the middle of a 3 month trip. The second was on the last night of my trip when I was by myself, I am reviewing this hotel for that time. A receptionist remembered me from the first time I was there, and so upgraded my room for free! The first time I was there, she also suggested loads of things to do when we went to Palm Springs the next day, and printed out road directions that would avoid traffic - life saver! The rooms are lovely, very minimalist but at the same time, comfortable and inviting. The only bad thing I would say about this hotel, is that a lot of things cost extra. I think it is a bit excessive paying around $20 for valet parking (especially as it is not underground/secure) and the breakfasts and meals are very expensive for what you get. Also, $3 for a small bottle of water?! But nonetheless, I would still gladly stay here, and it is very convenient for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service.”
Reviews.Author: Martin O
Reviews.Content: My family and I were traveling from Baja and wanted to be near the beach. As with most California Hotels, the rates are very high especially in the summer. So we found the Custom Hotel which was still close enough to the beach and close to shopping so that my wife and daughter could enjoy. The staff was amazing! Everything from the welcome greeting to the great, freshly renovated rooms to the close proximity to LAX and Venice Beach. Over all a great experience. Would highly reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: BandC738
Reviews.Content: The place opened a few weeks before we got there. Some very cool, trendy, modern decor and concept. We liked the place, the neighborhood, and proximity to other locations. The pool area is very cool. We can't wait to go back and stay a bit longer.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in LA”
Reviews.Author: reelhero
Reviews.Content: These guys are stars on the rise - the facility was going through a makeover - just about finished when I stayed there - and I think many people had no tolerance for it. Their loss. I had the most incredible stay. My room was spacious.. immaculate and modern. I loved the look and it was a sanctuary coming home after a long day of meetings and social events. Every morning before I headed out, I went and had breakfast on the gorgeous bar/restaurant deck area called Deck33, overlooking the pool with cabanas surrounding it, perfect for a Hollywood meeting (at night spectacularly lit by firepits). Here's where the custom ran away from the pack - not only is Deck 33 beautifully laid out and the food excellent (and i tried everything) but the staff was beyond gracious and wonderful. They made me feel like a part of the family while treating me like royalty. A difficult balance. It sent me off on my day with a breath of healthy air.. I cannot emphasize enough how invigorating that was. The staff here make you feel like they care about you and your experience. It's authentic I have an excellent BS meter, part of my job) and makes the experience memorable. A special shout out to Chris, the General Manager who was such a gentleman and went out of his way to make me look like a star to the visitors I had by. I work in the film/commercial business and I told many people what a bargain the Custom is.. I know for sure that already a shoot booked their production staff there based on my recommendation. I know they'll enjoy it as much as I did. Looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Experience”
Reviews.Author: jc350
Reviews.Content: I came to the hotel for the No Burner Left Behind party and met Xandra at the front desk. She answered some of our questions and then I decided to stay overnight. She was able to get us a great rate on the spot, a room on the 3rd floor for our dog, and even an early check-in. It really enhanced our time at the party to have the room. I even decided to stay another day. The only reason I did not rate the hotel excellent was that there was some noise at night (we were near an elevator) but just like the 'W' and similar boutique properties, you have to expect some noise if you want to carouse with the revelers. We moved to a further room from the elevator, something I'll remember to ask for whenever I stay at any hotel in the future! Overall however, between the great pool area and bar, inside bar, delicious shrimp and crabcakes, comfy beds, new flatscreen TV's with the latest Lodgenet system, it is a really great deal and I would definitely stay here the next time I visit LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great service basic rooms with an excellent chef and brilliant and bar and resteraunt staff we will miss them :)”
Reviews.Author: charliegurl
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the custom hotel , the room was basic but very clean and comfortable , during our stay you could see some renovations going on but it never disturbed us during our stay , the staff had a wealth of knowledge about the area and could not do enough to help , the pool area is a great place to chill with a drink and the fabulous food to try out too while you sit and watch the beautiful humming birds that seemed to like the flowering trees on the pool area , we would stay here again and will miss the people we met there ;) thanks custom hotel hope to be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay, avoid breakfast at restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Kristina1124
Reviews.Content: If you only need a night or two, this hotel is good. The night staff was unbelievably helpful, the day staff look at you with a "deer in the headlight" look when you ask simple questions. At 9 am I asked who I thought was a manager about the shuttle to the airport for a 10:30 departure she had to ask someone else and they told me it starts at 5 am. Well, why do I care if it starts at 5 am if it is now 9 am? I just needed to know if I should be in the lobby at 10:5 or 10:30. Breakfast was not the best. I got a $4 coffee that they never refreshed. I ordered well-done bacon and it was just as barely-done as my mother's bacon. She had the top of an empty sugar packet in her syrup container that no one cleaned out from a previous customer. It took longer to get the bill than it did to get the food and we were the ONLY ones there. I would recommend for a short stay without breakfast, but if you need long term, I would recommend another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for LA Stop Over - Excellent Bar & Restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: TorOnTour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Custom Hotel for one night based on their free airport shuttle and discounted room rate due to a recent refurbishment. The hotel was a great value 3 star property however I thought it could have been a little cleaner - the amenities in my bathroom had been used and the packaging was dirty, it was a little dusty and the fridge door would not close.
