Saying that, my overall impresion was of a great value property within a few minutes of LAX and a minute's walk from the Big Blue Bus stop which goes to Santa Monica in about 30 minutes for $1. Excellent!! I phoned the hotel after clearing customs and waited about 15 minutes for the car to arrive. It was driven by one of the friendly hotel staff, was clean and comfortable. My key was ready for me at the hotel on arrival and I was greated warmly, advised that the bar and restaurant were open until 10pm and the log in details for the free wifi and shown to my room. The room was compact but the bed was very comfortable (despite being a bit soft) and there was an iHome sound dock. I looked out over the airport, which was a bit of a boring view, but the rooms were well soundproofed and I didn't hear a single plane (or car) all night. The bathroom was also small but the shower had decent water pressure and the amenities (shower gel, shampoo etc) were quite lovely. After settling in I went in search of the restaurant. There was no information pack in my room or in the lift so it was impossible to know where the gym/restaurant/bar etc was unless you went to reception to enquire. Once I did that the bar was easy to find. To the right of the lobby there is a large outdoor pool area with cabanas, a fire pit and plenty of sun loungers. The restaurant and bar overlook the pool from a mezzanine level. I sat in the bar on a comfortable sofa next to a heat lamp - it was cool in the evening - with my book and waited about 10 minutes for the bar man to come over and offer me both the bar and restaurant menu. I ordered what turned out to be one of the best margaritas I have ever had (the Custom Margarita with orange and chipotle - delicious) as well as the Yellowtail Crudo which was a sashimi style dish with avocado and ponzu sauce. The quality was superb and far exceeded my expectations from an "airport" hotel. I also ate breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. It was a beautiful sun trap and the food and coffee were again of wonderful quality, particularly for the price which I thought was very reasonable. Overall I thought this was a great place to stay. As long as you remember that it is a 3 star, not a 5 star, then you should be pleasantly surprised. I found the service to be excellent (except for one of the bell boys who I thought could let the team down), the location was good, and the bar and restaurant better than I could have hoped for. The pool area is a nice touch, particularly for those hot LA days. As previously mentioned I couldn't find the gym and didn't see any of the other lounges as there was no directory advising where they were. I would have liked to be able to check them out. The renovations are nearly completed so if you're looking for an airport hotel that has a bit more style than your normal big chain hotels, look no further than here.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Trendy Hotel--Cozy and Decent”
Reviews.Author: ammagin
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here one night when we got bumped from our prepaid hotel. The staff was very nice and accomodating when we arrived. Our baby got to sleep in a brand new portable crib they recently bought to meet all the newest safety standards. The bed is a platform bed close to the floor which was an interest experience for those not using to kneeling to get into bed. The room was pretty small and I could hear some traffic noise. Very trendy, modern decor in the room and throughout the hotel. The pool looked very nice although we did not use it. The bathroom was small but clean. The sample size bath stuff was very nice--I took them with me. The carpet was a bit strange, the hallways too dark for me, and the elevators slow. Not my style of hotel but no real big complaints. Very convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler for over 25 years, I've stayed in hotels that have ranged from crackhouse to magnificent. Never can I remember a hotel experience being this bad. The Custom Hotel is next to LAX and therefore I thought it would make an interesting and convenient choice in a place to stay before a flight. The first problem is the front desk staff which was surly and disinterested barely making eye contact with me and rattling off the perfunctory check in info in a bored monotone.. After checking in, I was given a key to my room which didn't work, so I went back to the front desk and informed the bearded guy that my key didn't work. He rolled his eyes and gave me another key. That key also didn't seem to work, but after a few minutes of jiggling the door opened only to reveal that another family had already been occupying the room as it was full of luggage , food and toys. I went back to the front desk and instead of apologizing the guy again rolled his eyes and gave me a key to a different room. I was able to open the door but the room was small and ugly with very thin towels and stained sheets. The entire floor had an odd stench as well. The next morning when I checked out the front desk informed me that there had been severqal food and movie charges to my room. I said that was a mistake and the hotel saw that that they had another person checked into my room. Now, I realize that mistakes happen, and I tend to be a good sport, but the snotty attitude of the staff that I dealt with made this a terrible stay. The Custom thinks of itself as a trendy boutique hotel, but it is nothing but a an airport dive with ratty accoutrements and a really obnoxious staff.

Reviews.Title: “Service great room sucked”
Reviews.Author: lauralambert
Reviews.Content: Gerald was so good very sweet helpful all the staff was great room sucked left day early

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: hubin1
Reviews.Content: Stayed couple night here on Aug 2011 Pro - 1. coziness - room was cozy and well organized. the whole room was useful. 2. cleanness - the building is old but the rooms are pretty clean. room smelled fresh. bathroom was also pretty clean with good pressure shower. 3. TV - HD tv 4. comfortableness - bed and the bedding was pretty comfy. 5. friendly staff - valid parking was very friendly and the front desk was also very friendly and professional. Con - 1. noise - we got the room right by the elevator and it was kind a noisy. Room was not doing a good job of absorbing the noise either. Hotel looks very modern and they did a pretty good job. For the price and the location, it has very good value. Again, the building is pretty old but they did a good job of renovating. This is no 5 star hotel in Vegas but for looking at the overall value, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Setting the Record Straight - a frequent traveler's opinion”
Reviews.Author: wilreynolds
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets get into it... Getting there: The shuttle situation is a hot mess, as many reviewers have said. They got to figure this out...not getting picked up in a "mercedes van" is pretentious. Look when I get off an airplane and want to stay at an AIRPORT hotel, I know what I am getting. I'm just glad to have a shuttle, but its a mess, takes a while to get there and they don't have a van with the name of the hotel on it, which makes you feel kinda like you gotta keep your eyes peeled. The vibe: Yes this hotel is in a strip mall, and yes it is next to a bowling alley. But what do you expect for an airport hotel? Whenever I stay near airports, I don't expect to be in the cultural center with art museums and cafes in walking distance. But there is a great sushi place around the corner. I like the design though, its minimalist, and functional. The rooms: They are fine, they are a little weird / super trendy, but mine was clean and fine. I found that the comments related to dogs / cleanliness were the most concerning, but my room was completely clean. With really low beds and a shag style carpet I figure the low beds invite puppies up into them, and shag carpets make it harder to fight the critters that dogs bring with them. But my room was fine. The staff: They were good, people were welcoming, restaurant staff was nice, no complaints here. The gym: Decent, had a hard time getting into one of them, but they sent someone up (after about 10 minutes) to let us in which was a little longer than I would have expected, but whatever. The pool area: While I did use the pool, my room did face the pool area and I could see parties being a bit loud if they went on really late.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: Foodiegourmet2010
Reviews.Content: I had great stay at the Custom Hotel in LA! The service was top notch and the room was very clean. The hotel is in a safe location close to the airport and has a nice bar with decent food. The rate is very competitive as well and much nicer than the typical chain hotel competitors nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the web-site, not what it appears”
Reviews.Author: DrewCrew_515
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a brief layover stay at the Custom Hotel LAX on my return trip from DC, believe me when I say thsi....... NOT WHAT IS APPEARS..... The airport shuttle is NOT the Merecedes Passenger Vans, as they dont have the airport permits for them, so I was picked up in an unmarked mini-van by a valet driver. Did I mention that a guest was asked to hold a sign (Cardboard from a box and Black Marker) in the windshield so I could identify the van. The Valet driver was kind and very friendly though. Hotel is next to a bowling alley and CVS, but I assure you the area did not seem to inviting. The lobby is nice and the front desk service is good, but thats where it ends.... As I entered the hotel lobby elevator, I noticed the moving blankets hung in the elevators, thought, well they are remodeling..... nope found out those are decorations. Got to my room on the 10th floor, and low and behold, the rooms are something out of the Hotel Essex on Revenge of the Nerds..... Mood lighting= a strip of neon in the window. Drapes around room= covers for the shabby walls Bed= platform bed, nearly on the ground. Possibly Fung-Shei, but if you are tired or have hard time getting up and down, I wish you luck! Bathrooms were tiny, no ammenities like soap, lotion, shampoo or conditioner. Shower head was tiny and well odd... I could continue, but why? If you have read this, I'm sure you are convinced that you will not stay here-

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing and not appropriate for young families”
Reviews.Author: spuds000
Reviews.Content: Some good points - restaurant food delicious, staff very friendly. Bad Points - Our stay started and ended poor - would not recommend staying here. Firstly, it states on the hotels site that there is a shuttle service from airport - it does not say that you have to phone to book this. After finding the number and several phone calls later the shuttle service was not where it said it would be. After waiting and getting sunburned for over 2 and half hours we finally found the small unmarked mini van with driver still in it making no attempt to call our names out. On arrival to the hotel the receptionist Maile was very apologetic and provided a compensation credit to our room which we were thankful for, she also put us in a room that did not have an airport view. Apparently the 'new' shuttles have not yet received new permits so they cannot pull in where all the other shuttles do. Secondly, there was an issue with using the pool area, it was very disappointing on not only one but two of our days out of our 4 day stay there that we could not use the pool area due to it being let out to an external business and a group for a pool party. This was really disppointing as the nearest beach in Santa Monica was 40 minutes way by bus. Also we were printing out our boarding pass in the lobby, a fight spilled over from the party and a woman was arrested right behind us. A very unpleasant thing to witness at 10pm on vacation. This pool party apparently happens every Saturday and Sunday night - which would mean no pool opportunity for guests on these days.

Reviews.Title: “Small room & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: evajulez
Reviews.Content: Its dog friendly on floor 3. Newly renovated to good standards. Convenient next door to RALPHS supermarket. 10 min from LAX. Shuttle to/from LAX. I would stay again. Clean .. Friendly staff. LA tour VIP is very good comes to your door.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX and LMU; Good Value, a bit Trendy”
Reviews.Author: VictorW318
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here regularly over the past few years due to my daughter living right next door. Since the JDV takeover, things have improved over the final period under old management when this relatively new hotel started to show some signs of wear and tear. But now, the refurbishment is just about complete. Rooms are relatively small (at least the ones I book at the lowest prices) but comfortable and, well, funky - but very clean. Some older travellers may not like the low-to-the-floor beds and chairs, but they are comfortable. The bar/resturant around the pool is rather trendy, attracting a usually young crowd to various functions and parties, some of which get a bit loud. Upper floor rooms give you an expansive view -- mostly of LAX nearby which is what I had on this visit. The lobby breakfast bar is fine, if a bit pricy. I usually go to the diner-type place down the block, or to the Coffee place the other end of the block. And there's a Ralphs right next door. But no fridge in the rooms and no room service apparently. The only annoyance, one that they can't control apparently, is the lack of self parking. It's valet only (speedy however), and $20 bucks a night -- or you can take your chance and leave your car in the Ralph's parking structure (bottom), hoping you won't be towed. But that's a little risky.

Reviews.Title: “its ok i come back if the staff act like they care but they dont”
Reviews.Author: laddyred
Reviews.Content: i did not like the room that they put me n a room that only a kid can fit n the bathtub when i told the lady she change my room & n that room the ac did not work so they change my room agian n the ac did not work n that room 2 the house keeper bought me a fan until some 1 came out 2 fix it did no 1 never fix it then the fan only kept it cool at night n the day time it was hot n the room the self act like they dont care at all

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Minimal list in a good way, great location”
Reviews.Author: InglishSanLuisObispo
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I am always looking for options for my clients flying in and out of LAX. The lobby looks like a college dorm lounge. I do not mean that in a bad way, it is just very sparse, clean, and functional. It has a nice gathering area and long tables with outlets for your laptop w/free Wi-Fi. The rooms are small but efficient. The amenities in the bathroom are nice, towels were fluffy. Nice flat screen TV on the wall in front of the bed, IPOD docking station, small decorative light strand attached to the window operated by a remote control to change the color, etc. I played around with it and was not sure why this feature was here. Maybe it is like landing lights and they have a 60's flying them going on. No big bulky furniture. Honestly when was the last time you stayed somewhere overnight and unpacked? The bed was firm but comfy. I stayed on the 11 floor, it had a TV/computer lounge, very retro. The rooms also have a small window that opens for fresh air. Much better than AC for me (they do have AC). They do offer shuttle service from 5am-2am, everyday. When I was picked up at LAX, I was offered water and a snack, same thing the next morning. Not sure about long term parking. There is a nice restaurant on site, with a lounge and a nice pool area with a fire pit. There is a grocery store, bowling alley, and a small shopping mall, next door.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel once before - and before it was the Custom Hotel. It was then just convenient - now it is a well located, comfortable boutique hotel close to LAX, Venice Beach and within easy reach of LA through access to the freeways. There is a large supermarket next door for supplies. Stayed a couple of nights - very quiet room despite being right on Lincoln facing the airport. Only downside is the car parking charge - $18 with valet being the only option. There is plenty of parking behind the hotel - why not give registered guests free access to parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “two different sides”
Reviews.Author: craftycockneyconman
Reviews.Content: visited hotel twice in two weeks - first experience above sixth floor we had facilities such as fridge, alarm clock, ice, hotel guide and the well documented dog quilt. Not sure about coffee facility but have toured and would be the only hotel in 3 states that didn't. However very happy with stay and level of facilities including transfer bus. Returned today and got placed below sixth floor and apparently didnt warrant a fridge, alarm clock, kettle, room guide, ice machine broken on two adjacent floors, no dog quilt on this floor and to top it all have to check in on each day of our two door stay!!. Alledgedly make sure you insist on staying above floor six for full facilities...........

Reviews.Title: “Maybe after renovation is complete things will be better”
Reviews.Author: allornothingirl
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this little boutique hotel, especially after I got word that they were joining the Joie de Vivre group of properties. JDV is pretty reputable and rarely disappoints, but unfortunately Custom Hotel, at the time of my stay, was DEFINITELY not up to JDV standard. I'll start with the good: the location, very near LAX, was convenient, and being right next door to a grocery store was nice. A coffee shop is right down the street, and there are a few restaurants within walking distance as well. The staff is very kind, and they will send a courtesy car to pick you up from the airport or rental car stations. Valet parking is mandatory and expensive, but this is true for almost all LA hotels. The lobby looks nice, and although I didn't spend much time at the lobby bar it appeared to be functional and I saw other patrons there. That's where the good ends, sadly. The rooms are far less "boutiquey" and far more "hostel". The carpet in room is a blueish indoor/outdoor blend, which is not at all nice to look at or to feel on bare feet. There is a very small desk bolted to the wall with only an ottoman to sit on...not terribly comfortable or relaxing. No closet, just a wooden bar attached to the wall. The bed is very low to the ground and doesn't appear modern as much as "mattress on the floor". There is a flat screen TV, but it is bolted to the concrete wall opposite the bed that is draped in chiffon. The bathroom seemed fine to me - there is a bathtub/shower combo and the sink was large and everything functioned just fine. The WiFi is free, but good luck getting a signal - apparently the signal boosters have not been put to use and since the hotel is a bit of a metal box, the signal is VERY weak. Same goes for your cell phone while in room. I definitely realize that we could all use a break from technology overhaul, but while on a business trip, I need reliable internet and cell use, and it was very frustrating to struggle with this at Custom. The hotel is pet-friendly, which I love - would have loved to bring my dogs if I was not on a business trip - but I found a tick in my room. I understand that animals have fleas and ticks from time to time, but if you are going to be a pet-friendly hotel, you MUST make sure that your cleaning staff goes above and beyond to remove parasites for unsuspecting (and pet-free) guests. The workout room is a complete joke - I can only hope that it has not yet been addressed in the renovation. There are a few cardio machines, none of which work well, and the "personal TVs", if they work at all, only get 3 channels. Most did not function or even turn on. There are some cool and "hipster" elements to this hotel - a vending machine with all sorts of random items for sale (radish seeds, fishnet hose) and a strobe light in each room...but in Custom Hotel's attempt to be "cool" they are forgetting about basic comforts. My advice is to wait until the renovation is complete, look for some good reviews, and THEN maybe give this property a try. Until then, it is not even remotely luxury or boutique. It's just kind of gross.

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: flynomore
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I needed a quick layover place near LAX and the hotel provided free shuttle service. The hotel was nearing the end of it's renovation period and is an interesting mix of 50's architecture, 60's decorating and current technology. Rooms are urban sized small, beds are low to the ground but very comfortable. I found the room and public areas to be clean and the staff to be friendly. I missed a coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Also disappointed”
Reviews.Author: artslvr
Reviews.Content: I'm staying at the hotel right now and am terribly disappointed in so many ways. First, there is a loud party by the pool which is held every Sunday. That pulsating music is annoying and my room happens to sit several floors above the party. I asked the front desk what was going on and she said it'll conclude by 8:30 tonight. Second, there are limited amenities and the surrounding neighborhood is rather trashy. The bed is so low to the ground and god forbid they could offer more space to store your clothes. There is no closet, per se...just a rod with hangers in the room, plus two cubes that are supposed to serve as your dresser. The environment is so cold and impersonal. It wants to be trendy, but this hotel comes across as soulless. It makes me depressed to be here, but I'm being put up here on a business trip and feel terribly trapped.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: msfrizzy
Reviews.Content: Booked a room based on the proximity to Loyola Marymount University, the photos on website and discount offered by LMU to families of students. Wish I had checked reviews. My first impression was they tried hard to give the hotel a very hip vibe, but it was done very cheaply. Paint and carpets are chipped/worn. Furniture and wall decals look cheap. Pool was very inconveniently located (no hot tub either). The biggest problem was finding a satisfactory room. The overhead light in my room was not working and front desk promptly sent someone to look at it. Apparently, maintenance person couldn't do anything about it. I was moved to another room. Second room was a little warm and stuffy so I turned on AC - VERY LOUD!! I turned it to a lower setting...still too loud. I called front desk again. Same maintenance man came after 20 minutes. He fiddled with it for 15-20 minutes. No improvement. He told me all of the rooms were like that. I gave up & slept in that room with AC off & opened a window which was also occasionally noisy (LAX). Other problems with room: no ventilation in bathroom, bathroom door does not lock, no desk or table in room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with cool refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Km30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near LAX. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean, comfortable, a good size and recently redecorated. We ate a couple of meals at the hotel restaurant and they were excellent - fresh and full of flavour.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stay - fine for LAX, somewhat dark”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerFred
Reviews.Content: The hallways are dark grey and underlit, and showing signs of age with paint scuffed and worn carpets. It was creepy. The room itself was fine. Small bathroom, shower only (no bathtub). Seating at the "desk", which is behind the bed headboard, is somewhat uncomfortable. It doesn't make for a good working area. Otherwise everything else was fine. Relatively good value for quick stay near LAX, a much more "sylish" alternative to the Century Blvd strip of chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: martijnensandra
Reviews.Content: We were in honeymoon en stay two nights. Fantastic place en very kindly personell. Because it was our honeymoon, we get een bottle of champagne on our room. That was a surprise. Thanks for everything en special for employee Xandra. Greets Martijn en Sandra (key-woman)

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mjc2346
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way down to San Diego. The bed was literally 6 inches off the floor so it was hard to get out of. The TV was in an awkward place for watching unless you were laying across the bed. There was no in-room coffee maker which is standard in ANY other hotel we've stayed at in the past. There was no closet to hang our clothes, rather a clothes rack. The furnishings were scarce with only one uncomfortable chair and an ottoman available. The entry way was a dark dismal gray. The light switch to the bathroom was behind the door which is inconvenient as well as a possible danger since that means it was next to the shower. The sink backed up and leaked from the underside. Breakfast was available at a cost of $13 for an omlet and $4 or so for coffee. We went down the street to a great little coffee shop and had breakfast. We also noticed that the Fire Alarms were out of order. A pool was available but it was very small. There was Valet only parking. The valet guys were very nice and helpful however, when we complained about not having a free breakfast which most any upper end hotels have as well as the coffee maker, the woman at the desk acted as though she had never heard of such a thing. We would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. The people nice but beyond that, NOT!

Reviews.Title: “The best is yet to come.”
Reviews.Author: Gymfly
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this hotel based on online reviews and pictures. If you are tired of the same old cookie cutter hotel stays this is rreally a nice place. They were going through a renovation so everything was not operational. What they had they made the best of. Service was attentive and pleasant. Note that parking was not free but was valet style.

Reviews.Title: “THIS WAS THE WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER BEEN IN.”
Reviews.Author: allioopoop
Reviews.Content: You are not allowed to park your own car. Mandatory valet service for 2 nights was $16.50. No real glasses, just small plastic ones. Out room had no coffee or coffee pot. 1 small cup of coffee you get from downstairs costs $3. Many people walked a block each morning to a coffee shop. The room had no table, no chairs, no dresser or drawers for clothing. It had no real closet with doors, only a bar with hangers. Indoor/outdoor carpeting with no pad under it -- very uncomfortable for bare feet. One metal stool in bathroom with towels & washrags on it. One towel bar. After washing my long hair in the evening, I let it dry overnight the best it could, thinking there was no hair blower. I found it stuck on a top shelf in the hall the next day. The hotel was not aesthetically pleasing in any way. No framed pictures on bedroom walls. Just a dismal & dated looking place, with dark halls and aisles. Eating downstairs was at long metal tables. You could not wash and dry your clothes anywhere. You could only use their dry-cleaning service. You had to pay to use the downstairs internet for 15- to 20-minute intervals. The pits.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay...ever”
Reviews.Author: fabulousnow
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks cool from the outside as well as the mod-looking lobby and restrooms (although I feel bad for anyone who is intoxicated that tries to use the lobby bathroom as it is incredibly dark). As soon s you check in, the hotel goes WAY down hill, starting with their customer service. Prior to the stay, the person who booked the rooms for us received cancellation emails, even though we had not canceled. We were strictly told to arrive at 3pm to check-in; we arrived at 3:15pm and waited more than an hour for our rooms to be ready - and each time we checked the status of our room we received dirty looks from the receptionist. They did not offer us a drink, or anything to compensate for our long wait. Once we finally got to our rooms I was not impressed. The beds are literally inches off the floor, I found a dirty tissues on the floor, the walls were cracked and chunks were taken out, the shower had tiles that were cracked and dirty shower curtains. On the last day we all received random wake-up calls early in the morning for no reason as we hadn't asked for one. In addition, the valet driver broke my colleague's car door and he was given the run around in regards to when the valet company's manager would be in - needless to same he filed a claim and is trying to resolve it. Hotels and restaurants are all about customer service, this place clearly did not have that, and it was also a dump to stay in. I think I will stay at the Holiday Inn next time.

Reviews.Title: “posh and unique for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: jester33
Reviews.Content: It was super modern when we walked in, staff was friendly and the place was alot different than any hotel i have ever been to. Its next to a bowling alley which was fun since we didnt have to drive anywhere, and next to great food places. We paid a great price, bed was comfortable, bathroom shower was small but also cool and kinda space age. it is very minimalist, but it was very fun and different than those boring hotels with the 80's style decor! i am going to stay there when i get married,too. all in all, its a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Empty room with a bed on the floor”
Reviews.Author: yhart51003
Reviews.Content: If you are over 40 years old...forget it...There is only one hard chair to sit on, so if you want to watch the small tv you have to sit on the bed that is six inches off the floor. The pillows are flat and as hard as rocks so you can't even put them behind you to lean on. There is a strange little strobe light in the window...don't have a clue what it was for. The hallways are dark, but then so is the room...there are not even reading lamps by the bed. We couldn't even use the pool...it was closed for construction. This is the worst hotel room ever..if you doubt me, go ahead and book it, but you will regret it as much as I did.....

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Place and Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: rvrhere
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve been coming to The Custom multiple times a month and have consistently been impressed. Even during a remodel with stress levels high, both on the staff and patron level, this place still resonates with me. Great staff like Tomas and Xandra make the best out of this and any situation. JDV hospitality always does it right. If JDV were managing the remodel of your house, you wouldnâ€™t even know it was happening. Big Thumbs upâ€¦ Robert Van Roo

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fun, this hotel is perfect for an LAX layover”
Reviews.Author: Omillett
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here now four times, and keep coming back. They're currently doing a lobby reno, and I hope they retain their playful & quirky style. Checkin staff and bell staff are among the friendliest and most helpful I've had anywhere. I really feel like a B-list Los Angeleno movie star whenever I stay. Rooms are comfy, clean, modern/minimalist. Check out the wall of vending machines - you never know when you may need radish seeds or fuzzy handcuffs. Only drawback is location - not much to do in the area, but its primarily an airport hotel anyways. For the price, and for the experience, you really can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: worldgirl
Reviews.Content: Despite the hotel renovations going on, this hotel was fabulous! I was in between homes so traveling with my two well-behaved dogs... we never felt displaced. The staff is super agreeable, the valet guys always cheerful, the front desk folks -- Xandra and Chelsea very accommodating and kind. Great value and a sense of style for the bucks... plus the hospitable staff allows you to overlook their renovations... I'd stay again -- and in fact may be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We had an okay stay at Custom Hotel. We stayed there one night prior to catching a flight at LAX. The service is just okay and the style/decor a bit minimalist, but we found it to be an acceptable airport option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.... Going through some changes, but loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bandsareme
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel while on a trip to LA. The hotel itself is currently going through some upgrade work ( April 2011 ), but don't let that put you off!! The hotel is really trendy, and has a mega feel to it. The room was great, with a comfy bed, and just a nice clean feel to it!! The Wifi system needed a good old reboot while i was there, but worked all ok after that! ( if in doubt reboot ). We had a lovely meal at the Italian across the road that night, and it was like being in the TV series " The Hills ", it was ace!! Its right next door to a supermarket, and bowling alley!! We had a game, and won one game each :-)!! Well worth a visit for the money, you will find it hard to get better for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “We Got BIT...Custom Hotel Did not Care...DONT STAY HERE...”
Reviews.Author: steeltough
Reviews.Content: When my fiance and I pulled into the Hotel, two thugs were being arrested and cops were swarming the place. They only offered Valet parking for $15 a night. From the moment we walked in we were completely grossed out. There was a creepy vibe throughout the Hotel. The front desk hosts were very weird, the hallways were dark and gloomy and had an eerie feel about them. The room was very plain, and eerie, we were so freaked out we spent little time in the room at all. The bed was as low as the floor and had a weird Dog blanket on it. The shower was half the size of a normal bath and they had fluorescent lights blinking blue, green and red???? My Fiance woke up with some bug bites and they refused to help us determine the cause or even offer any sort of compensation...I will never stay there again, nor do I recommend anyone else. I am not sure how they are still in business.

Reviews.Title: “Local get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: danite
Reviews.Content: I went for a mini vacation, sure it's not far from my home but itnwas a deal I couldn't pass up so we stayed there for the weekend , What a great place,ideally located minutes from Venice and Santa Monica,it was very close to restaurants, bowling alley and markets. Staff was friendly, the lobby has this cool bar lounge, and the pool area had a Vegas feel to it, with a bar above and fire pit burning at night to just chill by, very cool hotel would stay there again for sure .

Reviews.Title: “overall a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: hellojamie60763
Reviews.Content: close to lax and not at all noisy. good rooms and service. only criticism is they really need to get faster internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Elecid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in April of 2011, and from the get-go I was impressed by the place. When I arrived, I wasn't initially expecting valet-only parking, but the valet was incredibly nice. I even forgot an item in my car, and he brought it around 5 minutes after he parked it with nary a grumble. I needed to make a couple copies of some business documents, and Aritza, the girl at the front desk, was happy to help me out. The food at the lobby restaurant/bar was delicious (fish tacos and Rogue ale), and the room was snazzy (to sound quaint about it). Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Service was amazing and enjoyed out stay.”
Reviews.Author: Abartholomay17
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern, My boyfriend and I stayed in late March at the Custom hotel. Hotel was very clean and upscale for the daily rate. Customer service was amazing down to valet to the very helpful man at the front desk (Tomas). Tomas went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable, asset to the company and I will return and refer other travlers to the Custom hotel cause of him. Thank you!! Will return shortly. Ashley

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Nesselnn
Reviews.Content: Dear Maile, Thank you for making our stay at your hotel a special one. We appreciated your thoughtfulness and enjoyed the good snacks! Sincerely, Pete and Joy

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Deserve the title of Hotel! Its "Custom" alright!!!”
Reviews.Author: TraveingDuoJA
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the hotel I could automatically tell that it was not up to standard. After we checked and went upstairs, we proceeded to open to door and a terrible odor slpaped us in the face. The bed was on the floor, sand in the iron and flat white paint to cover all of the rooms flaws. You could tell they were aiming for a contemporary chic image but completeley failed!!! I told my husband I could not stay in that dump. We went downstairs and they offered us a better room. The clerk, who was atleast nice stated "this is not your avearage cookie cutter hotel." She did not lie! The better room was the exat same with a mini-fridge! I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone or allow my dog to sleep on its dog decorated blankets! We immediately left and went to a COOKIE CUTTER Hotel! On vacation, I want to cut cookies and eat them too!!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for transit through the LAX”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Custom Hotel while en transit through the LAX. It's an OK hotel for a short stay. Our room was clean and comfortable albeit small. The hotel has a free shuttle to/from LAX and runs every 30-min. A cab from LAX to the hotel would cost around $20. Many fast food options around the hotel but not open late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: EWhiteford
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size and nicely decorated and the value for money is excellent. What stood outmost however is the standard of service. Chelsea and Artiza on the front desk went out of their way to make sure we were looked after. I pass through LAX regularly for business and I will absolutely be using this hotel again. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but ok”
Reviews.Author: N80
Reviews.Content: The good: Located close to the airport with free shuttle and minimum noise. Close to supermarket ,restaurants fast food and bus. The bad: Dark walls,dimly lit yet no black out curtains and the sun comes through the windows first thing in the morning. Small. No wardrobe just a clothing rack. Had a manky smell. Pool looked unclean. Have still not been refunded the hold charge on my credit card even though I returned home 3 days ago and checked out half a day early. For the price I expected a bit nicer and brighter,this was the 3rd hotel I stayed at on my trip and my least favourite for everything except that it was the quietest.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but basic”
Reviews.Author: MagnaCarta66
Reviews.Content: Negative: Restaurant, pool & outside bar closed. No fitness center. In room: no fridge, no coffee maker, lacks any furniture to hold clothes, dim lighting. Positive: In room: free wifi. Within 2 mins walk: 2 supermarkets & 2 Thai, 1 Indian, a few Sushi & pizza restaurants. Free airport shuttle. Not noisy from airport. Parking behind Ralphs supermarket is free.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: City of Big Bear Lake, California
Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacquimae15
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the custom hotel in February 2011 over all it was a okay stay. We arrived a little earlier then expected and they let us check in early! When we arrived to check in 1 of the 3 front desk girls was extremely rude and got angry when we had too come back down to get keys that actually worked for our door, however the other two girls were very nice! The biggest bummer was you HAVE to pay for valet parking! The guys who do the valet parking were very nice though, made it worth it! We got back to the hotel at about 1am and come to find out the bar at the hotel was closed...wish they would have said something when we checked in... We ran into the security guard who was very friendly! Over all the staff is very friend in exception to the one front desk girl (wish we would have got her name), the rooms are nice and comfortable and decorated pretty cute! We will be returning in June to hopefully see some new improvements!

Reviews.Title: “Under new management”
Reviews.Author: antnywallis
Reviews.Content: A real change has come over The Custom Hotel LAX. Always the outstanding bargain for foreigners visiting LA it is now under new management (JDV Hotels own lots of quirky local hotels throughout California). It has everything you need if you are not from North America.It is not overheated (but it does have perfectly controllable aircon and heating) you may open a window (LA has sea breezes along this coastal strip) your room comes with a frig, the bathrooms are small but newly refurbished with a beautiful oversize German porcelain basin, the bed and linens are wonderful. Ok it is not pretty but the rooms are a welcome change from commercial hotel chains and do have an overall aesthetic of modernity with their bamboo tables and mexican lampstands. And the front of house staff are charming; hopefully you will encounter Tomas who is especially helpful. He may even give you a peek at the designs for the coming complete refurbishment of the property mid-year. All in all still a bargain among LA hotels and although near the airport is brilliantly connected for getting around the place by freeway (think the new 105 which takes you a long way East in a hurry) Although the restaurant is temporarily closed you can get everything your might need for breakfast & other meals right there in the large foyer. It even has an inhouse bar now. Besides immediately adjacent to the hotel is a Japanese Grill, a coffee shop. a Ralphs super market and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Consistent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jj_996633
Reviews.Content: Maybe not the hotel with crazy amenities, and it definitely has it's own unique style, but for the price, really it's perfect. I sleep great here too, the low bed, mood lighting, and good mattress make for a great night's rest. It's definitely not a cookie cutter hotel. While you're there, say hello to Aritza, she's joyous, spirited and will take care of what you need, plus a friendly smile, really making it a warm place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, super helpful, great location.”
Reviews.Author: 3impressions
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected suprise. The hotel was super friendly, willing to please, and go out of the way to help. I would totally come back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff! Jasmine made my stay!”
Reviews.Author: LoveandLights
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start. The staff is so amazing especially Jasmine! She handled all of my crazy request and didn't complain when I asked for more!! Everyones so nice and so helpful from valet, to front desk, to the bellman! I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Alright but not as fancy as the website portrays it”
Reviews.Author: Maanya
Reviews.Content: We had plans to travel to LA for a weekend and a discount deal came up on one of the travel sites for the Custom Hotel. Since the rate was very attractive and the location was okay too, we decided to give it a shot. Pros: Checking in was a breeze, we were given a Queen room with a view on the 11th floor. The view was supposedly that of the Pacific Ocean but we couldn't see anything apart from the LAX runway. The decor was pleasant and everything looked clean. Cons: The size of the room and the layout disappointed, it was very tight getting around. The bed wasn't too comfy either. Parking was not free. The giant blow up of some random lady in the elevator was a little creepy. All in all, a decent hotel. Alright for a single night or a few nights stay if you can get a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent front desk girls! thanks jasmin & xandra!”
Reviews.Author: andynatty
Reviews.Content: jasmin & xandra at the front desk are truly the nicest girls i've ever met at a hotel lobby. they both worked so hard to get me a room after hotels.com completely messed up my reservation. these girls are what every hotel needs to stay in business. thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aldob21
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. They have a great restaurant and beautiful pool area with a bar. And best of all was the service. Make sure you ask for Aritza, shes the best!

Reviews.Title: “Shall Return”
Reviews.Author: jpm1973
Reviews.Content: The service of the Hotel and it's staff I found outstanding there manner and overall attitude to the customer's were great. Granted the Hotel is having a huge overhaul yet I didn't hear nor see this. It is apparent though the staff seem keen to inform you at any time regarding this and have found myself looking into book again around the time all this is due for completion. It's of great ease and positioning for local markets and coffee shops. Plenty of places to grab food also again walking distance and most seem to deliver. All in all I intend to and will be doing rebooking to stay there again it has everything a Hotel should and is local to many amenities and attractions. Its free wifi is fine too and didnt have any issue with you can pay for premium wifi though the free version is fine for most users I would guess. I just found it a friendly and growing Hotel and liked its quirky style and looking forward to its full upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Great end to a bad trip...”
Reviews.Author: brokenhearted_trvlr
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel late on a Friday night to meet the very glorious Anitza behind the desk with a wonderful smile and her signature curly hair. My trip so far, had been less than pleasurable. When I arrived, all of my troubles seemed to melt away as Anitza set me up with my room quick and painlessly. I asked if it was possible to have a newspaper. Anitza promised that in the morning when she came in, she would bring me the paper of my choice. After living for some time in Los Angeles, I am very accustomed to yea-yea service, filled with empty promises and a lack of results. Anitza assured me it was her duty to ensure a wonderful stay at the hotel and she came through. She delivered; she and the staff did everything short of coming to my room, tucking me in, giving me a kiss on the forehead and saying good night. That was not on the menu, but would have been a nice touch. This was a great stay, great value, JDV hotels rock and I will always come back to this hotel when I return to LA on business.

Reviews.Title: “A mini W, comfortable, fun with cool staff”
Reviews.Author: thierry0101
Reviews.Content: The Custom Hotel near LAX has become my home away from home since December. It is a mini W at mini prices with maxi fun, cool and personable staff who greet you by your name and seem to enjoy their work. The public is young and hip, the location next to the airport (and yet quiet) in a real neighborhood, with family restaurants and supermarkets. It has almost all you want in a hotel. Microwaves and coffee machines in room would be a good addition. Check it before they change the magic recipe! Thierry.Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “They dont tell you about the 20.00 per day parking charge untill you leave”
Reviews.Author: ttowngal32
Reviews.Content: Was not told that it costs an extra 20.00 for parking at check in so be warned. All parking is valet which I didn't really like. Everything else was fine, room was clean, TV was really nice, staff were very friendly, bed was very comfortable. Waiting to get my bank statement, If I was charged for parking, I will stay elsewhere next time I am in LA. High speed internet was not working too well but didnt really matter to me because all I wanted to do was sleep

Reviews.Title: “Spooky looking”
Reviews.Author: madeit19
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to everything stores, parks, library, beach, resturaunts, the Hotel itself is very creepy it has a old 1950 insane asylum hospital feell, something you would see in movies, first the elevator has a creepy looking women picture as a mural, the hallways are spooky grey the rooms are more like a boutique style room the bed are on the floor with a creepy doggy comforter on it, there are curtains on the wall the bathrooms look like a old hospital bathroom, there is no room service or microwaves or refrig. Other than that it's ok

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 1-night layover.. more than that? not recommended...”
Reviews.Author: justpumpitlouder
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1-night layover. I'll cut right to the chase: this hotel is fun in design, but is starting to appear run-down. Not a bad choice for a one or two night stay (its proximity to the LAX international airport is ideal), but I wouldn't recommend staying there for any longer than that. It's like the Philipe Stark version of a Holiday Inn Express. Pros: Staff at the front were very friendly young girls, check-in was a breeze, the airport shuttle was convenient and quick (the driver was also very nice and made conversation), the room was definitely nicer than any other run-of-the-mill airport hotel, and the unique character of the place was something I probably won't forget anytime soon. The bed was also super comfy (but low to the ground, so if you're older and have trouble getting out of the bed early in the morning, not so sure this is a good place for you to stay), free high speed internet, and local television channels on the lcd-tv; no room service menu, but found it super easy to order delivery from a local pizza hut Cons: The floor in my room was dirty & stained, the walls were dirty, the paint was peeling off the shower walls, the paint was chipped by the door, one of the bottles of water were missing from the desk upon checkin (upon telling the girls downstairs to ensure I wouldn't get charged, they actually ended up comping me for a free bottle of Fiji which was nice), the ice-machine on multiple floors did not work, and the pool restaurant BistoTek or whatever it's called was closed.

Reviews.Title: “A weird, weird, hotel, but fun in a quirky sort of way”
Reviews.Author: IntlPilot
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay near LAX for one night. Got the hotel through Priceline, I believe. Good value for sure. A converted apartment or something. Everything is weird about it. The main lobby area has a bar/ gourmet coffee combination in the back. Prices too expensive for beer and food not that good of a deal, either. Very nice, attractive staff. Couldn't place the accent. Gym on 2 floors, weights on 5, cardio on 6. Both very well equipped. Weird. Room colors, battleship grey with some whites. Weird. Shower/ tub combo a small square. 3'X3'. Be funny to see somebody sit in it. Weird. Faucets reverse-threaded. Weird. Excellent sound proof window on one wall, drapes cover 2 walls. Weird. Desk situated behind bed. So, it goes wall, chair, desk, head of bed, foot of bed, space, window. Weird. Free internet. Fast. Pool parties every day. Weird. Free transportation to airport. Excellent location, ESPECIALLY for around LAX. New mall next door, short walk to Japanese, Italian, coffee shops, Taco Bell and KFC. Liquor store across street, Ralph's Grocery store and a bowling alley virtually attached. More remodeling occurring. Bus service right out front (BIg BLue 3 to airport and east one way, Santa Monica the other. #117 to airport.

Reviews.Title: “In transition, perhaps remaining hip”
Reviews.Author: BoltzMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Custom a couple of years ago, just after it began being almost over-the-top hip, with darkly painted (and very cool) halls, edgy rooms (including the minibar with good alcohol as well as sex toys!), slightly arrogant staff (to let you remember your place) and a very, VERY fun pool/cabana/club. But staying there last week, we found that it's "been sold" and not only is the "Beware of Dog" ambiance (pencils, dog-pictured duvets, and other inexplicable references) gone, but so, alas, is The Sheep from the Lobby (ask, please). We're told the "Bistrotek" restaurant is closed permanently, and the minibars are gone, leaving sadly empty refrigerators in the rooms which remain nice, but no longer edgy. Yet the Desk Staff was incredibly helpful and eager, and assured us that the transformation was going to be even better (if sheep-less) than before, in merely a few months. So we'll be back. For now, it's a very affordable and cute place, and I think the club remains an interesting venue. Parking is $20, yet proximity to a Ralph's next door and a fun bowling alley (with extreme bowling!) adjacent make it possible to still be a little bit twisted for a weekend. The lack of coffee maker in the room is regrettable, and the amenities are slim, except for excellent (and free) Wi-Fi. There appears to be an airport shuttle, as well, so it gets some convenience points, too. We'll be back...at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Was my room cleaned?”
Reviews.Author: Eyegun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night and it was one night too many. First of all, the room key didn't work so I had to lug my luggage back down to the desk to get them to re-key the cards. Lighting in the room was woefully inadequate. Not bright enough to read anything. There were several long black hairs plainly visible in the bathtub as well as a man's whiskers in and around the sink. The bathroom floor was obviously not swept. The finish on the bathtub was flaking off around the drain. The bed frame was broken. I went to the restaurant at 7pm on a Saturday night to find it totally deserted. Sat at the bar for 10 min- nobody came so I went elsewhere. Good location near LAX ($12 taxi ride), off approach/departure routes but next time I'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want to party !!”
Reviews.Author: rileyred
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the airport but the main noise was from poolside parties! So great place if you want to party in LA not goodif you want to sleep after a 12 hour flight ! Hotel isquirky but very clean, nice bed linen.Did not eat there so can not comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - Beware of Parking charges”
Reviews.Author: Venkat418
Reviews.Content: I used priceline bid and got the hotel for 2 nights @ $60/night (including taxes). I was actually looking for Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn. These hotels come under 2.5 star category. They are the ones that come with free parking and breakfast. Having breakfast and parking at the hotel saves your time and makes your stay comfortable. To my surprise, custom hotel also came under the category of 2.5 stars. I think custom hotel would satisfy the minimum requirements of a 2.5 star hotel. Following are the negative things I noticed:- * Valet parking - $20 / night + tax. No matter how good your deal is, a parking fee of $22 is way too much. For this reason, I had to park my rental car in a parking garage and reach the hotel with the shuttle (parking lot to airport and airport to hotel) * Hi speed internet - you either get 384 kbps internet for free or pay $9.95 / night for hi speed internet * Room style/color - the whole hotel is painted black and gray. Gives you an impression that you are in a prison. There were broken pieces in the wall. * Shuttle - Be prepared to wait in the airport for atleast 20 mins from the time you make a call to the hotel. * Breakfast - Not many items to pick from but priced high. A subway or McD on the way is advisable * Drinking water inside the room - be ready to pay $4.5 / bottle for Fiji Water. There is an alternate option bottles provided by custom hotel is $3/bottle. We took our own bottles Positive things:- * Bed - Comfortable * the rates are lower for 1 queen bed than 1 king bed. Most hotels come up with either 2 queen beds or 1 king bed but custom hotel does come up with 1 queen bed. This could be a pro or con depending on the number of guests in the room. Overall thought - I would have spent 2 hours in the night daily moving between the airport parking lot and hotel with all shuttles. I feel vacations should be relaxed and comfortable. In my opinion, the hotel is not very comfortable. The hotel simply charges its guests for various "Incidentals" in every possible manner. Tip/suggestion - if you are doing a priceline bid for a 2.5 star hotel (expecting a hampton inn or a similar kind), make sure custom hotel is not listed as 2.5 star. The best bet is go for 3 star. I definitely did get the hotel cheaper than most other guests but as I said, the hotel is not comfortable for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service. Very bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Cuesta82
Reviews.Content: Overall I would say that my stay at the Custom Hotel was totally marred by the horrendous customer service. It started when I landed at LAX at 10:45pm. One of the big reasons why I chose this hotel is because they had a shuttle service. When I called the hotel to alert them of my arrival, the rude hostess informed that they shuttle driver "had left for the night" and that I would need to get a cab. Nevermind the fact that I informed the hotel well in advanced that I would arriving at 10:45pm and that the cut-off time was 11:00pm. When I got to the hotel, I found the staff to be equally as frustrating and uninviting. Furthermore, the breakfast bar and the hotel restaurant staff were rude as well. I think this hotel has some serious attitude issues. The hotel is in poor location (basically in the parking lot of a Ralph's supermarket). I would not recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, convienent location on the West Side!”
Reviews.Author: FitTravellerLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We come to LA monthly to visit family on the west side...usually stay @ airport hotels, Hilton or Embassy Suites. Noticed ads for the Custom Hotel (a refurbed hotel which is visible from the right side of the airplane when you land @ LAX...next to the OTIS bldg)...it has been refurb'd into a trendy, albeit austire botique hotel. I don't mean austire in the pejorative sense--if that's you're design aesthetic, you'll enjoy this hotel. It definately has more character than the airport Hilton, however the rooms are half the size...same w/the Embassy Suites, but, given the price difference, it's woth it. We are here for just 1 nite & for us, it's a trendy dormitory. My preference is Tuscan fluff, but I'm not here for vacation. The bed is very comfy, the amenities, sufficient, & the staff was friendly. If you enjoy the austerity of loft decor, you'll love the place (bed in the middle of the room...interesting use of space!) Not my personal taste, but I'm willing to stay here again. BTW, we were in room 326, a corner room facing the sunset& not on the main drag of Lincoln Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Than Bates Motel: A bizarre nightmare from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Sucker
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Los Angeles International Airport, which is why we stayed there overnight prior to an early morning coast-to-coast flight. The building has a nice, large red neon sign, making it easy enough to find. However, we couldn't find the lobby entrance for quite a while - it's in the rear, along an alley. Valet parking is mandatory, which I didn't like but was too tired to go out hunting for a parking meter late at night. The desk clerk was having a telephone conversation that lasted about ten minutes before she condescendingly checked us in. The "bell hop" who took our luggage upstairs also seemed to be the janitor. The halls are dark gray and foreboding. "Twilight Zone" best describes the hallway experience. Our room was on the 10th floor, and a sign near the elevators informed me that the ice machine was on the 9th floor. Said ice machine on the 9th floor didn't work, so I picked up a courtesy phone and was instructed to check the ice machine on the 8th floor. Finally, I got some ice. When I got back to the room, my wife told me that there was no heat in the room - and it was about 45 degrees F outside. The desk clerk sent up a space heater, but we couldn't get the room much above 60 degrees F until we stuffed a vent in the bathroom with tissue paper so the cold draft would stop filling our room with arctic air. The bathroom once had a heat lamp in the ceiling, but it had been replaced with a back-yard flood light that had been carelessly painted red. There was no coffee in the room, but expensive bottled water was available for purchase on top of an in-room refrigerator. The hotel does have a very dark and dreary restaurant that is very, very expensive. The appearance of the restaurant reminded me of a loading dock in the back of a big box department store. We did not eat there. In the morning, I called valet parking and asked them to bring my car to the front desk area. The front desk clerk was talking on the phone and never said a word to us, so I tossed our room keys on the desk and left. We waited about 15 minutes for the car before I decided to go outside and investigate. I spotted our car a short distance up the alley, but there were no keys in it. I finally got the desk clerk to get off the phone long enough to point me in the direction of the valet office at the other end of the alley. A valet got my keys but wouldn't give them to me. He obviously was seeking a tip because he asked if I had any luggage to load and if I was going to go out and come back in. I told him I would never return and demanded my keys. We drove off feeling that we had just escaped from a concentration camp. My room reservation was for $85 - but added taxes and fees (including $22 for parking my car in the alley) brought my final cost to $149. We could have stayed at a nicer hotel for a lot less money. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Heartless Staff from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: browningKeats
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay with Custom Hotel for my grandparents and husband. Two days later my grandmother died. We had to cancel our rooms at the hotel in order to be with family; her death was completely unexpected. I had my husband call to cancel our rooms and get a refund. However, to add insult to injury, the staff was very unsympathetic and said that they would not refund one penny. We canceled our rooms four days before our actual arrival date (typical refund policy requires you to cancel 3days-24hrs before the arrival date in order to get your refund). I couldn't believe that two days after I made the reservation and four days before my arrival date, the hotel would not even give me a partial refund. When I tried to explain why we had to cancel, the hotel wanted to see a death certificate and then "they would think about it". I will never stay at this hotel and I will never book through HOTELS.COM again. Is there any compassion left in the world?

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: rlm99
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. Better prices and facilities at any major chain in the LAX area. Apparently they got a bargain for military surplus battleship grey paint so that combined with the dim lighting the hallways have the charm of a tomb. They also apparently got a bargain by buying liquidated clothing racks when Montgomery Ward went out of business, putting them into the rooms instead of closets. No coffee pots in the rooms, so when we asked for one we were told there are none, not allowed in the rooms. Fire hazard? Then how explain the steam iron and hair dryer? No self-park although there is plenty of space available, and $20 valet parking is not fully revealed in the website.

Reviews.Title: “Weird and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: beebsbents
Reviews.Content: This hotel is focusing too much on being trendy, and not enough on being comfortable. First off let me say that I am 26 years old so I get the whole young hip cool boutique hotel thing. I travel to LA quite a bit and I have stayed at many different hotels in the LAX area. This is my least favorite hotel. There is no closet in the rooms, only a rack to hang your clothes IF you are lucky to have hangers, mine did not. There are vending machines only on the 6th floor and the time that I went there they did not have sodas or snacks available only two vending machines selling weird toys. The hallways are painted a depressing dark gray with matching carpet for an extra gloomy dungeon feel. The bathroom was very small and my shower curtain had mold, and on top of that the shower head was not properly working. The bathroom door does not shut, only slides so not much privacy there anyone can just walk on in. The valet parking seems totally unnecessary as the valet parks your car in a lot that is literally 50 feet away from the entrance of the hotel. It should be self parking and it should be free. There is one thing I liked about this hotel and that is the wireless internet is free. Oh and also the price was ridiculously cheap. I just keep reminding myself of that as I am standing in my tiny shower with low water pressure and walking all the way to Ralphs just to get a soda.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean but not the right choice for someone who plans to spend time at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: PSU93Girl
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Custom Hotel in Los Angeles, CA and I found it to be a very nice, clean hotel with helpful staff. But it is definitely not the hotel for you if you plan to spend a lot of time in your room or if you have a family. The pool is TINY (I saw a woman swimming "laps" and it took her 8 strokes to get across the pool, 9 if she went diagonally from corner to corner. The pool is more of a place to hang out and be seen than a place to take a dip and cool down. The room was nice, though I found the placement of the bed smack in the center of the room to be a bit odd. And I had never been in a hotel without a dresser in the room before. There was a free safe, which was nice, and it was big enough to hold my netbook computer, iPod, jewelry, and BlackBerry with plenty of room to spare. The bathroom was very sparse but again, if you're using the hotel room as I did--a place to sleep and keep my belongings while I spent time out and about with friends--it was perfectly adequate. Valet parking was $22 per day and they took good care of my rental car. There is no self-park option, which was a bit disappointing, but the valet service was prompt and never delayed me from getting to where I needed to be. There is a grocery store right next door and if you tell them you are staying in the hotel they will give you one of their discount club cards to use during your stay. There are several coffee shops and restaurants in easy walking distance as well as a Bank of America. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel--and the reason I wouldn't recommend it for families--is that there is a poolside bar that gets VERY loud and stays open very late at night. The first night I was there was a Wednesday night in the summer and the only thing that allowed me to sleep (I had one window that faced the pool) was that I was jetlagged from my flight. I was on the 3rd floor so I would recommend paying the extra money for a room on a higher floor to avoid having to hear the pool bar noise all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it Cheap too”
Reviews.Author: boogiebook
Reviews.Content: Near the airport ... Trendy .. Cheap . Good drink at the bar expensive though ... Grocery store and bowling alley very close ............

HotelInfo.Name: Custom Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8639 Lincoln Blvd, Westchester, Los Angeles, CA 90045
